Reviews.Title: “The owner makes this place great!”
Reviews.Author: laewagne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while we visited Vieques. We liked staying in Esperanza because thatâ€™s where the bio bay tours leave from and also if youâ€™re into a seeking out a little drinking fun this is the town (and Lazy Jacks is the place)! Mark (the owner) is the reason you want to stay here! However, he is currently trying to sell the place. Overall the hotel is a bit dated but itâ€™s clean and comfortable (If youâ€™re used to 5 star accommodations this place is definitely not for you). Heâ€™ll tell you all about the Malecon (the main drag in Esperanza), small stores to get groceries, beaches you can walk to, good snorkeling spots, etc. And if youâ€™re really nice and chat him up he may tell you about off the beaten path restaurants, etc. He has complementary coffee in the mornings (and sometimes throughout the day!) and a computer in his lobby with internet. When our cab didnâ€™t show up to take us to the ferry Mark drove us in his own vehicle â€“ now how many hotel owners would do that! Mark is a truly unique and great guy. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Thanks Mark!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Spot”
Reviews.Author: Emil V
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a month on Vieques. We travel the Caribbean 2 or 3 times a year, and this is still our preferred vacation. The hotel is clean, comfortable and also affordable. The owner, Mark, is knowledgeable and more than helpful. We stayed 4 weeks and used room #6 (the "Apartment") which is a full home unit. The location is ideal for us, as we don't enjoy the 'night-life'; yet it's close to everything on the Esperanza. Wi-Fi availability is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Brian435
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Casa Alta Vista in February. The location is great. You can walk to some of the beaches, and the rest are a very short drive. Restaurants and bars a few minutes walking. The owner Mark goes above and beyond to take care of you. At this price, it's a very good option.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing....Simply beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Lisa S
Reviews.Content: We just left vieques last week and when booking the vacation, I wanted to feel as far away from home as possible. I wanted to stay somewhere to get a really great feel of the island. Casa Alta Vista was perfect! We checked in Saturday and met Mark who is so personable and gave us a map tour of the island of all the places that we needed to see, great places to eat and the best beaches to visit. The room was cozy (we got the top floor one bedroom with a balcony, was the best room in my opinion :) ) Had comfortable patio furniture, a fablous view of the sky at night and a wonderful view of the ocean during the day. The room had everything we needed and was perfect. The room was clean, the water was hot and I got the best sleep I have had in years. The walk is maybe a little over a block to get to the boardwalk in espearanza. We walked to get breakfast everday morning and was a nice walk. There was never one moment that I was anywere on the island that I didnt feel safe. At the end of the 8th day, it felt like home. We woke up in the morning, went downstairs to get coffee (was the best on the island) and say hi to Mark and Sasha (his cute dog) and chat about what we did the day before and where we were off to that day. We would tell him things we came across and Mark was always able to give us more insight on the questions we had about the island. Everything was perfect. I reserached for months before settling on a place, I went back and forth between the hotel and guest house options and read review after review and finally decided on the guest house. I am so glad I did! A hotel never would have given the same feel that the guest house did, simple, cozy with no other distractions- just living life and it was great! I would like to mention, I read the reviews before I booked my trip on this site and there were people who said it was a bad thing that this property was for sale. Mark has lived on the island for 10 years and running the hotel. He is there every morning at 8 and was even there late some nights to accomidate people coming in from delays with the ferry, some even as late at 9 or 10 at night. He does a great job and yes, the property is for sale, but but never once while I was there did I ever feel that him taking care of the place and the people staying in it were not his first priority... and he does a great job at it. And after 10 years, who can blame him for wanting to take on another adventure? If I ever came back to visit the island I would stay here again, the location was great, it was clean and quiet and exactly what I hoped it would be for my perfect vacation. Thank you Mark for everything!!! It was so good to meet you and I wish you the best in whatever you do- Give Sasha a hug for us!!! --- Kevin and Lisa

Reviews.Title: “Would avoid this place.”
Reviews.Author: JDK7983
Reviews.Content: I wish I read the latest reviews before booking. Guess it used to be a nice place. Now it's falling apart. Gotta love the car seats in the lobby that came from a pick up truck. I will say the AC worked, the sheets were sort of clean, shower was decent, had hot water, was only $75/night. But it needs a lot of work. Guy that runs it was very nice and helpful, but I don't think he cares about the place anymore. Thank god I didnt see bugs, it looks like they were hiding somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: Ak169808
Reviews.Content: Casa Alta Vista has seen better days. What once seemed like it was a nice hotel is now for sale and is crumbling around the edges. Reviews on Trip Advisor led me to believe I would be staying in a cheap, but otherwise comfortable hotel, but there were many aspects of the stay that were unacceptable, even in the cheapest of hotels. While the owner was very nice, here were some of the issues we had: - Moldy ceiling made of tin. When it rained it sounded like gunfire and woke us up in the middle of the night. - Dirt and mold on other parts of the room--mold on the fridge and big scuffs on the walls. Dirt piled up in corners of the room - TV in the room did not work. Wifi that worked at a snail's pace. - Multiple spots of dried blood on our sheets. - No on-site staff to enforce hotel rules--like when a local family with visiting relatives who were staying in the hotel, were having a party on the roof that involved playing instruments until 12am on a Tuesday night. - Air conditioner worked intermittently. Bottom line: Do NOT stay here. There are similarly priced alternatives in Esperanza proper which are in much better shape.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Island!”
Reviews.Author: nktz
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time on Vieques. Casa Alta Vista is a short walk to the beautiful beaches and nearby small grocery, the malacon, and restaurants etc. The place is basic, but very comfortable, if you are looking for a resort type place go somewhere else. If you like a good value, this is it. We had the apt, with a full kitchen and were able to eat/prepare meals etc. which was great when traveling with kids. We also did not rent a car/none were available but managed quite nicely without one because of the great location. The owner, Mark was a great resource and guided us to all the best spots and has some amazing stories about the island as well. Hope to go back one day!!

Reviews.Title: “OK place but look around for other options first”
Reviews.Author: HojasRojas
Reviews.Content: I would love to give a better review but want to advise people to look around first for other newer/cleaner options within the same price point. We paid $75/night for two. I learned after that there are other guest houses near by starting at $85. The location is a short walk from the strip which is great and a short walk a beach. The owner Mark is very friendly and knowledgeable and we really appreciated his tips of what to see on the island. He has the place up for sale and not having stayed there prior I would guess he is ready to move on. He is not on site much but can be reached by cell phone (which we did not bring travelling)... The wifi is patching and has to be requested. Our room was ok but the furniture is dated, there wasn't any soap/shampoo filled in the dispenser in the shower so bring some. The TV didn't really work which was ok for us as there is alot to do near by and the weather was great for us. The room was not refreshed during our stay. I would have loved a broom to sweep up the sand that collected.... as well everything seems to have a layer of dirt on it, need a good scrubbing! The sheets seemed clean and the A/C worked.

Reviews.Title: “It was just for one night...”
Reviews.Author: Chico13
Reviews.Content: I would love to give a better review but we weren't really impressed. Yes it is a guest house but like the soap dish in the bathroom was not clean. If our room had been clean, it would have been fine. We had the nicest view for sure. AC worked. Mark was helpful. Location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good home base for family of four”
Reviews.Author: justabubba
Reviews.Content: The "family room" was not the nicest room in the hotel, but provided separate sleeping space for the two kids and plenty of room. The hotel is not luxery, but clean and Mark, the owner very helpful with information and advice. He made arrangements for us for trips and transportation and made it possible to hold our luggage for a long day after checkout. (Don't be mislead by comments about the property being for sale.) Location is an easy walk to the beach and provides separation from the noise. An inexpensive, lean and friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Visit Vieques on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: Redbecca_46
Reviews.Content: Casa Alta Vista is truly a room with a view! Once you're settled in your room, head up to the roof for sweeping views of the ocean and night sky. The rooms have AC and are clean, comfortable, and adequate; certainly not fancy, but this is a guest house, not a hotel. Each room has its own clean bathroom. You won't miss the TV's (which are present but don't quite seem to work) as there is too much to see on the island to ever need one. Mark is a great host and provides excellent information about what to see where. He'll also work hard to help you out with a taxi should you need one. Casa Alta Vista is a couple blocks away from restaurants and sites, with a convenience/grocery store nearby. This ads to the solitude: You can be in the thick of things when you want, yet have peace and quiet when you don't.

Reviews.Title: “Just a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: sgonzal75
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and have to say we found the room to be very clean and comfy. If you are expecting a 4-5 star resort, this is not for you, but if you are looking for a place that goes hand in hand with the town of Esperanza, the Malecon, and countless beaches, then this is the place for you. Mark-the owner, was awesome and a wealth of knowledge regarding all the best beaches to go to depending on what your preferences are, what to expect from the locals (who are very nice, btw), and your dining options . He is super accomodating and a great host...as was Sasha, the resident dog. Esperanza is a sleepy town and this place is just the same. The sun deck is great and offers some great views of the sea and mountains. All in all, if your looking for a clean, a/c'd place to crash while you're visiting Esperanza, then this is definitely the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Allykirk
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant stay here. Rooms are basic and no-frills, but have A/C and reliable hot water. Views are excellent. Balconies and Roof-top deck are very nice extras. My biggest complaint about the room was the air-conditioner was the noisiest one I have ever heard. It rattled the metal shutters which made it worse. We spent alot of time trying to stuff tissues into the shutters to get them to quiet down. Other than that the pillows were very flat. It is a very good location, just about a 5 minute walk from all the hotels, food and bars. It is also within walking distance to Sun Bay. The owner Mark is really nice and will go far out of his way to give you advice, or anything you need.

Reviews.Title: “If I go back I'd go there”
Reviews.Author: osky1900
Reviews.Content: If you consider four variables: price, situation, staff and cleanliness I'd say it has at least 7 points (from 0 to 10) as a average. The owner, mark is so kind and tries to help you as if he were a tourist guide(he does it pretty well).

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: PattySpencer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Alta Vista for 25 days over the Christmas holidays 2010-2011. Our host, Mark, was both unfailingly affable and accomodating. The construction next door is finished so it is quiet. The distance to the malecon (boardwalk) is NOT that great (2 blocks). While hot water (solar-powered) was more available in the latter part of the day, Mark installed a tankless water heater during our stay and so there was ample hot water all day long. We intentionally chose to be away from the main drag to avoid late-night bar-scene noise and were glad to have made that choice. Yes, the guest house is close to the road, but there is comparatively little traffic on it. We enjoyed the clip-clop of passing horses and the crowing of roosters and the iguana that sunned herself atop the tree canopy each morning across the street. All in all, a good choice for tourists with a modest budget.

Reviews.Title: “Super value close to Biobay with excellent host!”
Reviews.Author: Nomad0921
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at Casa Alta Vista with my daughter to visit the local bio-luminescent bay. This is not a luxury facility, but quite functional and very convenient. We had two rooms on the third floor, one of which has a veranda with a sitting area overlooking the surrounding area including the ocean - a nice feature which we enjoyed during the mornings and evenings while we were gathering. There was no elevator - while walking up the stairs was not an issue for us this may be a consideration for others. The rooms were clean and had mini-fridges and a/c - the a/c units were a bit noisy which may have been the only down side of the stay. WiFi was also available which was convenient. Mark our host was exceptional, a wealth of local information regarding nearby Esperanza restaurants and running routes for me. Mark was also able to provide towels and a snorkel set rental from his in-house inventory - a plus! The location is very close to Esperanza - 5 minute walk or less - we took a taxi from the Vieques airport. We did not need a car for our 2 day stay. The main drag of Esperanza with restaurants, bars, shops and the tour company for the biobay tour was only 10-15 minutes walk from the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, good lodging if on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: elawgrad
Reviews.Content: Bottom line, it is a great price for a comfortable place to sleep. There was adequate air conditioning and hot water. Despite another review to the contrary, the bed had clean sheets and was comfortable. In the most immediate review, it is worth noting that MAJOR construction is going on next door and there is tremendous noise with jack hammers. However, this was not an issue for me since I get up early . In the other reviews, there was mention of a "cool" owner. Never saw this guy during my two nights three days there. The property is for sale, so there may be a certain degree of decline or "don't give a [--] attitude" by the employees, but they were by no means discourteous. Since the property is for sale, I would read any subsequent reviews to mine, in case there is a decline in service/facilities. Just wanted to share a neat experience. One night on my walk home from the strip after dinner, I heard a PA system and saw bright lights. I walked a couple blocks and there was an adult league softball game. I sat in the stands and enjoyed the game, as well as watching the locals. Instead of cracker jacks and popcorn, the concessions included Coors Light and empanadas.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill fast”
Reviews.Author: shapoopie
Reviews.Content: We were not pleased with our stay at the hotel. The hotel is up for sale, and it seems that they are just ignoring any problems with the place because of that. The walk down to restaurants and the beach is too long, and treacherous because there are no sidewalks and cars drive really fast down that road. Also, it is worth noting that there is major demolition/construction going on directly next to this hotel right now. The workers get started promptly at 8am with jackhammers. Also the front desk person totally messed us up. I asked her to dial the number of a hotel for me (she refused to let me dial myself) so I could make a reservation. She dialed, talked to the person for a second, then handed me the phone to make the reservation. I didn't think about the fact that I didn't get to hear the hotel answer the phone. She called and booked me at the wrong hotel in Old San Juan. So when I got to San Juan to the hotel I had asked her to call for me, they did not have my reservation. Luckily they had a room, but I had no idea who she called, and who I consequently made a reservation with. Lots of confusion. Luckily the hotel that I originally booked with called me the next day, and refunded me the money that they charged my card for the room. But, that woman caused me a big hassle, lots of unneeded stress and confusion, and could have cost me $200 for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Mark, the owner, is what makes this place so cool.”
Reviews.Author: Notnef
Reviews.Content: Very basic accommodations which was what we expected for the price. Rooms were clean but a bit dark. Pay the extra and get a room with a balcony - we wish we did. The owner is fabulous. Take the time to listen to his suggestions of where to go and what to do. We loved the location - just out of town but an easy walk in. So none of the noise of the cars driving by. Be forewarned there is occasional construction next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, friendly staff, nice accommodations”
Reviews.Author: a_olson82
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for three nights in March. We had Room 12, which as far as we could tell is the best room in the house. Beautiful corner balcony, Great views from the rooftop terrace. The staff was helpful and friendly and accommodating - they let us leave our luggage for a few hours after checkout behind the front desk so we could enjoy the last hours of our trip without carting it around. Easy walk into town, and the bakery around the corner is a jewel! We kept the windows open and didn't have the AC on because the weather was so beautiful and the ocean breezes so nice. There are many, many, boisterous roosters on the island, and we were awake by dawn each morning - an experience in itself, and one which in no way marred our trip, as we had extra time to enjoy our stay! If you would rather not be disturbed, the AC and closing the windows should help, but why sacrifice the beautiful ocean air? We didn't mind at any rate. Our room was average size, and a great price. Clean with a mini fridge. Tile Floors. No Kidding, I cried when we left Vieques. A treasure of a find, and so glad our guide book by "Let's Go" recommended it!

Reviews.Title: “this is the second time we stayed. Great...”
Reviews.Author: jamiedeanwalker
Reviews.Content: this is the second time we stayed. Great value, clean rooms, great rooftop balcony with view of carribean. Owner Mark is very helpful. Walking distance to restaurants including the wonderful quenepos. My wife and I rented bicycles and went everywhere on island including the beach. The alta vista is quiet but close in, perfect for seasoned travelers who want to avoid resort/chain scene.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Luvs2G0
Reviews.Content: Room was pleasant and comfortable, rooftop deck was fabulous for morning coffee and sunsets. Mark was a wonderful source of info.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: coqui1957
Reviews.Content: At first I was excited, Mark was very informative... but soon lost that feeling. Up the stairs we went, our room was ok for the price paid, I needed a hot shower and a good night rest, The shower ran cool even after running it for 45 min. I called Mark, he said just let it run it should warm up, the hot water didn't work, I jumped in and showered quickly. Later I found out you need let the hot tap run in the sink, after it gets warm, run the shower. We didn't plan to watch T.V. while in Vieques, just a bit of the news, weather, and Olympic updates, before turning in, only to get a scambled picture on one spanish channel. Mark said at least 2 channels should work....not on our T.V. Our bed was hard and uncomfortable, I woke up with neck and back ace. We only stayed 2 nights, and was very ready to head back to San Juan, just to get a good night sleep, and some good Puertorican food. My husband told me you get what you paid for, I agree. Over all Esperanza is not what we expected, our latin flavor was missing. I didn't feel like I was in Puertorico, it felt more like Key West Fl. The little eats around this town are priced too high for what you get. Where's the latin music, comida criollo, monfongo? next time I'll go to my family house for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, nice owner”
Reviews.Author: gdcincy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 days in early Feb. Room was clean & everything worked. Employees were extreamly helpful and pleasant. Store only carries the basics (ice/beer/soda/snacks/etc) but at a better price than the stores.Pleasant 2 min walk to the strip. Owner, Mark was eager to answer any questions and not hesitant about lending a hand or giving a lift if needed. A really nice guy trying to see you have a good time. Been to Vieques twice and #3 will definately include staying at Casa alta Vista.

Reviews.Title: “You might like this place, if you have low expectations”
Reviews.Author: TravelTimeKC
Reviews.Content: Casa Alta Vista's best quality is its location. It's only a five minute walk from the "strip" of tourist bars and restaurants in the town of Esperanza. We actually liked that it was a bit further away from the strip so it was quiet at night. Beyond the location Casa Alta Vista has some serious drawbacks. The dirtiness was the one I couldn't really get beyond. When we entered the room we looked at each other and immediately stripped the stained coverlet off the bed to languish in the corner for the whole stay. The sheets and towels, well, all we could do was hope they were "stained". There was definitely dirt in the corners, I showered with my beach shoes on, the bathroom was pretty run down. Lots of tiles were either cracked, or missing, and the in-room toilet plunger didn't exactly inspire confidence. A towel rack was missing from the wall, but not to worry I found it stashed in the drawer of the armoire later. The room does come equipped with a mini-fridge (rust covered on the outside), an air-conditioner (cleverly plugged in with extension cords hung across the room from the cranks on the window shutters) and a TV which the owner said "only picks up a few channels since they went digital on him (make that no channels, there is no analog broadcast anymore. We didn't mind the lack of TV, but would have appreciated the owner not trying to pretend that we might get some reception.) The owner talked up the rooftop patio, which does have an amazing view. It also has piles of trash and broken umbrellas piled around it. The rooms are OK size-wise, and several rooms have covered patio areas in front of the doors with patio furniture. But, keep in mind the windows don't have glass, so when your neighbors are enjoying their patio time they might as well be in your room with you. The noise level can get pretty high. One last issue to consider is that there are no in-room safes for valuables. The owner spontaneously told us he had never had any issues with thefts, but there are signs warning that the hotel is not responsible for anything that is stolen. It's a little hard to decide what to do, we didn't want to take everything with us to the beach, but we weren't totally comfortable leaving things in the room either. I'm not a super fancy traveler, but from talking to other travelers around town for the money you pay for Casa Alta Vista you can get similar accommodations that are more carefully maintained. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in the beautiful islando of Vieques”
Reviews.Author: Anamom
Reviews.Content: We went to Vieques with extended family after a nephew's wedding. We rented two rooms (the two bedroom and the family room). It was low season so Mark let us rent one of the room for only one night since part of the family was leaving the next day. The rest of us stayed for two nights. For those of you that love a remote island with the most beautiful beaches then Vieques is for you. The accomodations are very simple, nothing fancy at all. But the service at Casa Alta Vista is great. Mark is such a great person willing to answer any question and help you out anyway possible. The cleaning lady also went out of her way to make sure we were fine. The hotel was only a 3 minute walk to the main small town of Esperanza. About 3 blocks away there is a little supermarket and a bakery so we visited it quite a few times. Our trip was amazing. We are certainly going back to Vieques and staying at Casa Alta Vista once again. A great value, clean rooms and a great owner. Thanks Mark!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean”
Reviews.Author: quaintvacations
Reviews.Content: We LOVED VIeques!!! The Casa Alta Vista folks were wonderful and all the other rooms were probably awesome, but don't stay in No. 1. It's downstairs, with no view, and a poor patio. It is handicapped accessible. This hotel was great for being close to everything in Esperanza. And the prices are very reasonable. This is a 3 level hotel, with a rooftop terrace. The terrace was not attractive, but we didn't waste time at the hotel with all the great beaches on Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and extremely convenient!”
Reviews.Author: vasyr
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Casa Alta Vista this past weekend for just one day. Many places would not allow us to stay for such a short time, but Casa Alta Vista accommodated us with pleasure. We were running VERY tight on time... we took a pÃºblico from the ferry and by the time we arrived to the hotel, we only had 15 minutes to check in, drop our bags, change clothes and get back to the front of the place for the tour bus to come pick us up. The young woman working the front desk (had dark hair just past her shoulders, I totally forget her name) was SO great to us! She understood we were running on a tight schedule so she gave us a quick run-down of things, got us checked in VERY quickly, gave us some emergency contact numbers, and helped us get up to our room. We made it to the tour bus just in time. The next day, we had to look up information on some car rental agencies for when we returned back to the main island. We also wanted to do some quick sight-seeing while we were waiting for the next ferry. She arranged our transportation back to the ferry, helped us look up information on car rentals, directed us to a great little bakery nearby, showed us how to find a hidden beach with an amazing view, and more. She chatted with us a bit and REALLY made us feel at home. I am a very inquisitive person... I always ask too many questions but she was very pleasant and more than willing to answer all of my typical tourist questions. The facilities are actually in good shape, considering the age of most of the buildings on the island. I read some of the complaints from other guests that stayed here before; honestly, I think they are just being WAY too picky. We were very happy with our accommodations. Our room was very clean, had hot water, a/c, a small fridge, cable TV and comfortable beds... not fancy but it was just perfect and worked well within our budget. I'm a little bit of a clean-freak when it comes to hotels and I felt very comfortable sleeping here, which says a lot. By the way, there ARE roosters roaming the entire island... no matter where you stay, you will hear them. However, Casa Alta Vista is far enough away from where most of the chickens hang out so the crowing was off in the distance and didn't wake us up. I was really worried about not getting enough sleep, but it was no problem. Also, Casa Alta Vista is located right down the road from the Malecon, only about a 3 - 5 minute walk. My friend and I walked down there at 10:00pm and felt very safe walking along the road. The road is very well-lit and it's literally right around the corner. My friend and I both made the comment to each other than when we come back next year, we are definitely staying at Casa Alta Vista again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, would not return though”
Reviews.Author: hoyadbcoach
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying I am not one that prefers all inclusive travel. I more prefer laid back hidden gems. I have stayed and loved hostels in Spain, laid back beach resorts in West Africa, Rincon Puerto Rico and Mexico. I like off the beaten path places, so my critical review is not due to being one who prefers high end accommodations because I do not. With all that said, I thought Casa Alta Vista was overrated by its Trip Advisor reviews. I feel like the location is good, and the service is OK, but everything about the hotel is very very average. The service is OK, the people are friendly, but the continental breakfasts are coffee, muffins and warm milk and cereal. I feel like they nickle and dime you on certain things. The set up of isla vieques is one that it is difficult to bring a lot of luggage in, so people do not bring coolers, beach towels, umbrellas, etc and they charge you for this which I feel is exorbitant. Hectors By The Sea and other places include these in your room for free. The rooms are OK. The A/C in room 11 made a lot of noise if it was on for more than a few minutes so it was difficult to keep it on when you sleep. In addition, there is no staff at the hotel after 7:30 so if there is an issue, you best wait it out until morning. All this is OK if you are paying 50-60 dollars a night or are staying at a hostel, but for the rates they charge it is not good business. The owner is also not friendly. He likes to burn CDs, but not interact with his customers and see if they are enjoying their stay. Hector and Mary of Hector's by The Sea make rum drinks and give tips to their visitors. This guy never even said hello. All in all I loved my stay in Vieques. I would advise anyone to go, but I would stay at Trade Winds, Hectors By The Sea or Villa Coral before I went to Casa Alta Vista. I will probably return, but I will look to stay elsewhere. E-mail me at HoyaDBCoach@yahoo.com if you have any more questions.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely go back to casa alta vista”
Reviews.Author: ziggy1177
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed her with my sister and brother-in-law for four nights. the two rooms we had were clean, straightforward, and a great value for the money. they are not big or fancy: but, when you're in vieques, you really only use the hotel room to sleep and shower! the hotel's location is excellent: close enough to the bars and restaurants along the beach in esperanza, but far enough away from the action to be quieter and more peaceful. the staff at the hotel was knowledgeable, friendly, and so accomodating: we loved that we could pick up beach chairs, a cooler, snorkel gear, and a few snacks/drinks in the lobby before heading out to the beach. the rooftop deck has beautiful views of the ocean and mountains: be sure to check it out at sunset. of course there were some regular island "noise pollution" factors here: roosters crowing, dogs barking, and the noise of the rain on the roof; however, that was all par for the course when staying in a more remote location like vieques. those factors would not dissuade me in the least from staying at casa alta vista again. we loved our visit here and hope to return someday...

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE...last resort accomodations”
Reviews.Author: CaliGrammaof2
Reviews.Content: If you can put aside the dogs barking at 3 AM, the cold showers, spider webs on the ceiling, which is metal, so during a rainfall sounds like you're being shotgunned, your neighbor's toilet flushing sounding like it is in your room, dingy rooms...this is the place for you. Just around the corner we discovered Esperanza Inn at the same rate, but with lovely guestrooms and kind new owners... They are even closer to the malecon and provide a great continental breakfast in a kitchen rather than Alta Vista's storefront area. Must say Allta Vista's refrigerator and fan worked well. WILL NEVER RETURN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on a budget, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: johnsonkr2
Reviews.Content: Lots of pros and cons to this guest house. It is on the main road in Esperanza so everything is easy to get to and within about 8 minutes walking, but away from the main part of town, so it is mostly quiet. However, it is in the residential part of town so it can get a little noisy at night from chickens and dogs, so I would recommend asking for a room on the rear of the building away from the road. The rooms are small, but clean and inexpensive, and the staff is very helpful with booking Bio Bay tours or helping you rent a car for your stay. There is a great roof deck with a grill that you can access from the third floor. AMAZING view of the Esperanza harbor and sunsets from there! The room I stayed in had a mini fridge and a TV, but trust me, you won't use the TV unless it is pouring outside. Casa Alta Vista has a little convenience store on the first floor where you can get food, drinks, rent snorkeling gear, and any other little necessities that you may find yourself without. They also rent scooters, but a car is much more helpful to get to the beaches on the far side of the island like Green beach, which is great for snorkeling. But you won't need a car for every day that you are there. There are two beaches, as well as some cute little shops and places to eat all within walking distance of your room. And the Bio Bay tour bus will pick you up from the parking lot of Alta Vista, so save your money for a day and just explore on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Eiger20
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Casa Alta Vista for 2 nights in December. Overall, the room was worth the price. The room we had was small but had enough room for two people (assuming you aren't spending much time in the room). The bathroom was sufficient and for the most part clean. We actually had a spectacular view of the mountains from a small window in our shower (Rm #12). The service was excellent and we found that the staff went out of their way to accomodate us (make dinner reservations, give directions, taxi pick-up's, etc.). The rooftop deck has an amazing view and is great for lounging at night and for eating a quick breakfast (for cheap and easy breakfast go to La Dulce _____ panederia - walk one block towards ocean and make first left and then first right). We also had our own patio area where where we could hang wet clothes, snokel gear, etc. (seperate patio but not secluded from view of other rooms). Esperanza main strip is only 5 min walk from hotel. A few minor down sides were tin roof (we had 3rd floor room and heavy rains were LOUD), roosters making noise quite often (yes, even in middle of night), and rental charges for everything (bikes, towels, chairs, etc.) We rented bikes for $15/day from hotel but they were in pretty poor condition. We were able to bike all the way to Blue Beach but it took an hour and was difficult since bikes were stuck in low gear. Be careful snorkeling at Red Beach. We swam out to island about 100 yds off shore only to realize that current on way in was very strong. I would not suggest doing this without fins unless you are VERY strong swimmer and even take caution with fins if you are a strong swimmer. Currents can be dangerous and ther are no warnings. Snorkeling really wasn't worth the effort. Note that if you plan to rent a car, many rental places have minimum 3 day rentals during high season. The small, basic rooms are made up for by the great location and roof top views. The convenience store downstairs is nice to grab a snack or a 6-pack of beer. I'm guessing this is one of best accomadations near Esperanza for this price range. Our favorite beach was Blue Beach and Playa Luna. If you get there in teh morning you can easily have 300 yds of sand to yourself. We loved the beaches on Vieques and the lack of crowds made it all the more wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Love Casa Alta Vista”
Reviews.Author: WMW63
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Vieques. Tha hotel is well located from Esperanza, the beach and the restaurants. The acommodations were simple but very clean with a small fridge and a microwave in the room. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. They made our reservations for the Bio Bay tours with Island Adventures and it was perfect. Perfect hotel for the active traveler who enjoys a very active day in the island outside of the property and just wants a nice and clean room to rest. It also offers a small store where supplies at modest prices. They also rent beach chairs, coolers and beach towels.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodations fit for a Mofongo”
Reviews.Author: kylie_adie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day stay at Casa Alta Vista. The hotel was only 5 minutes walk from our favorite breakfast hangout, "Belly Buttons", in the sleepy town of Esperanza. We enjoyed a lazy afternoon lounging on the patio, enjoying both a mountain and ocean view and listening to the random crowing of roosters from surrounding houses. The amenities were clean and decent, but we felt the bedroom and bathroom could have benefited from a makeover. There was no HBO or CNBC, only Spanish TV shows, but we had no problem with that, since it allowed us to catch up with our reading. The staff were friendly, laid back and informative. IMO, while this hotel was not particularly conducive for a romantic getaway, we agreed that it was a good experience overall. We even named one of the endearing house cats, "Mofongo", after our favorite Puerto Rican plantain dish.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: CableTec
Reviews.Content: My wife booked a stay in this house/hotel in preperation for my cousin's wedding on Isla de Vieques, and it turned out to be an entirely terrific descison. The owner, Mark, and his staff were incredibly accomodating with everything, and they went out of their way to ensure that we not only knew where we were going, but that our needs were met in the most expedient way possible. If we needed to go somewhere, they callled us a cab and also rented us an Izuzu Trooper- which now I realize, is the best option if one is going to explore the island and find the best dive spots, etc. The inn itself is centrally located in Esperanza, which is the tourist section of town and boasts some very good eateries. The rooms are clean, but sparsely furnished, at least by American mainland standards, however the accomodations are certainly comfortable, and I slept very well even with the in wall AC unit humming away, and the tree frogs chirping. We arrived during a relatively short offseason, so many things were closed until the holidays, but we still managed (with Mark's help) to find some good snorkeling spots and restaurants. I could go on and on about how helpful and welcoming he and his staff were, but it would probably still not do justice to how knowlegeable they are about how to get things done on Vieques. He is the man to see, no doubt, and had some great recommendations for our next stay on the island, which will need to happen for sure now thanks to the wonderful time we had in large part due to the staff of Casa Alta Vista. We will happily be staying with the only "gringo" in town when we head back. Thanks Mark and Everyone! Brad and Jennifer

Reviews.Title: “Check out Tradewinds first”
Reviews.Author: S_Bettac
Reviews.Content: Our beds were literally crawling with bugs. I had to spray them down with Off before we could sleep in them and even then we had bites. The toilet ran all night mimicking the sound of "mom", "mom", so I couldn't sleep. The way the rooms are set up if anyone in the near vicinity arrives to their room in the middle of the night (frequent occurence) it sounds like your door being opened Which, by the way, we found out could be done very easily by a butter knife when we locked ourselves out of the room and could not reach anyone at the resort to help us. We loved the gal at the front desk that greeted us the first day, but the buck stopped there. Try Tradewinds (or pretty well anywhere else) if you plan to visit. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dianaprince4
Reviews.Content: Very basic ........ but centrally located ....... a/c worked great..... very convenient store downstairs . Great if you need a decent place to shower and crash after a day of exploring or being at the beach. Check in staff very helpful ......... provided me with a local map and pointed out popular locations. They also arranged to rent me a jeep which they have right on the property for a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “You will not regret this”
Reviews.Author: juzzme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Casa Alta Vista for 2 nights.It is located in a convenient location. About 5 minutes walk to a stretch of restaurants.Casa also provide simple breakfast like cereal,muffins,coffee.The staff are super friendly and ever so helpful which makes our stay even more comfortable.I will definitely recommend Casa to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a nicer island”
Reviews.Author: Escopeton
Reviews.Content: This was our second time on Vieques; first time for my kids ages 10, 7 and 4; second time staying at CAV. Mark and his staff are friendly and very helpful (although I didn't see any faces from last year). We stayed in room #7 which was the family room and my mother in law stay in room #4 which was the first floor up. The kids slept in a bunk bed and our bed was a queen size. We had a fridge and a microwave that we used frequently. Our rooms were tended to when we went to the beaches and we brought back a lot of sand when it involves three little kids. Mark had a continental breakfast for us every morning which was a nice touch. I didn't take advantage of the breakfast because I was up and early out fishing the flats on the island. It is close to the restaurants in Esperanza. My next trip to Vieques may be a a couple of years but I will have no problems staying at CAV again.

Reviews.Title: “PR first timers”
Reviews.Author: DeucesOfTheGreatNW
Reviews.Content: Checked-in without any problems. We made out reservations by phone and received a nice email confirmation. We stayed on the top floor and had a view over the trees to the water. As with most of the other reviews, we found the room to be small and you will basically want to use it for sleeping, showering, and changing. Small fridge in the room is very convenient. Store downstairs as all the basics and very reasonable prices. Staff is friendly and helpful. We rented both a scooter and car directly from the CAV, but you'll probably want to make sure these are available when you make your reservation and/or checkin. Roof patio is a communal area and we met several friendly guests up there, including some who we would eventual go to dinner and drinks with... Town is just 2 blocks away. Roosters will wake you up nice and early, but the neighborhood is good and fairly quiet. We had islandwide power outages while there, but this is common on Vieques and not CAV's fault. CAV has lukewarm water most of the time, but it gets you just as clean as hot water so deal with it. Overall, a nice clean place to rest your head with more services and advice than you would expect from a small average looking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very affordable and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: jsbby
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at Casa Alta Vista in Feb of '07 we enjoyed the hotel. Especially the roof deck , the views are wonderful. A Nice quiet place. We also liked the fact that we could get up every morning and go to the malecon for breakfast, and just to hang out and take in the scenery. The rooms were nice .We basically just , showered and slept . The accomodations were great. A refrigerator in the room kept our snacks and drinks cold. The beds were made and rooms cleaned everyday. Awesome.Very affordable.. We are going back in April '08. Can't wait. Nice thing is , we are in the same room we were in last year. We have two boys and they also had no complaints at all about anything. Great famiy place.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Hawkfish
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasnâ€™t too bad. We stayed there four nights in March 2008. The best thing was that it was quiet and just a short, pleasant walk to the malecon area of Esperanza. For this reason, itâ€™s probably better than the guesthouses right on the malecon, which I think would be rather noisy. There was a small refrigerator in the room, and the hotel has a convenience store right downstairs where you can purchase drinks and snacks. The young woman who handled check-in and ran the store seemed nice and helpful. Also, the room price was fairly moderate by Vieques standards. However, the room was small, dark, and cramped. This is a place that you just want to use for sleeping, not hanging out during the day. There was a semi-private balcony that was good for drying our snorkeling gear and towels, but it looked out directly on a partially constructed house next door. The rooms on the top floor above us (we were in room #3) might have a better view and are probably preferable. The air conditioning was adequate, and the room seemed clean, although in the dark light it was hard to tell. The shower was big, but there was never any hot water for any of my showers. The water came out slightly tepid, so you could stand it. My friend did manage to get one hot shower one afternoon, so hot water does apparently exist on sporadic occasions. In summary, this hotel is probably adequate for one or two night stay and may be a reasonable value by Vieques standards, but if you are staying longer, you may want a little nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Really Made our Stay in Vieques Easy and Fun”
Reviews.Author: jdbird
Reviews.Content: Except for one early and unexpected booking problem we had an excellent experience here. What I loved most was that it felt like a home base of sorts for our vacation. We were absolutely new to the island and the people there really helped us out. They were kind, helpful and enthusiastic about giving us suggestions on the things we absolutely had to do before we left Vieques. They booked our Bio Bay tour for us and went out of their way to get us a scooter when we did not reserve one. If you are staying on Vieques I recommend getting a car. We had a great time on the scooter but there were some rough roads that would have been easier to travel over in a car. Casa Alta Vista is not fancy but it was exactly what we needed. It felt very integrated into the "town" itself and I felt connected with the island experience. It was also ideally located for Esperanza. We only had to walk a few blocks down the hill to get to the "town" and we could walk back up and sleep in relative quiet when we were done. They also have a great roof deck. I would encourage anyone going to Vieques to stay at Casa Alta Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad!!”
Reviews.Author: joedestin
Reviews.Content: This review is late but still have great memories of our anniversary in Vieques. After a day of driving a rented jeep to all those beautiful beaches it was nice to go to our 3rd floor unit at CAV for rest and a hot shower. Our unit had a nice balcony and opffered some privacy along with basic sleeping quarters. Mark and his staff are nice people who will do their best to accommodate you in every way! I would definitely stay @ CAV if we visit Vieques again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!! comfortable, affordable, informative & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kelley425
Reviews.Content: This place was just what we were looking for! Accomodations were clean, comfortable and afforable... just what we needed and more, a HOT shower with great water pressure, spacious for 2 people, there is a roof area to sit that has an incredible view of the island and at night, star gazing. We stayed in room 4 on the second level. Laid back, friendly atmosphere, helpful staff There is a convienent store on the ground floor, coffee and muffins complimentary in the AM (rumor has it that they will be building a breakfast nook area soon for additional breakfast food, great idea!). The hotel is literally steps to town, 3 minute walk to town of Esperanza (Hope in spanish),The town has restaurants, bars and a beach to go snorkeling. Best way to get around is to rent a truck to see ALL the amazing beaches. Okay and best part, hotel owner, Mark is passionate about the island and making sure your stay is not only pleasant but that you experience the best the island has to offer. Gave us a map and descibed each beach, good restaurants/bars, and which Biobay tour to take. He made us feel right at home. We only had 2 nights and 2 days to see the island, should have spent all of time right here at Casa Alta Vista in Vieques than on mainland PR. what an adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Great people, perfect place”
Reviews.Author: n_nosh
Reviews.Content: The place is perfect in price, location, comfort, facilities etc. Mark (the owner) was extremely helpful, rented us his Isuzu trooper and gave us great recommendations. A special thanks to Wayne who gave us a ride to the airport, when we woke him up at 6:45AM!!! (remember this is an vacation island) because our taxi did not show. Did not even have to ask! Thanks Wayne!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Vieques”
Reviews.Author: xuquer
Reviews.Content: I had such a wonderful stay in Vieques and in large part because of Casa Alta Vista. The place is great, near the beach but just far enough from the main drag to make for a peaceful place to retire for the night. Rates are reasonable and the staff couldn't be more helpful. I look forward to returning to Casa Alta Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to get away from it all”
Reviews.Author: beachbum371
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely amazing. The hotel was nothing fancy, but it had exactly what we needed. The view from our room was gorgeous and the people who worked there were so helpful and nice. When we come back to Vieques, we will definitely stay with Casa Alta Vista!

Reviews.Title: “cheap place to crash, not much else”
Reviews.Author: qb20
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the staff - everyone was awesome and superfriendly. The room was very very basic, which is what you pay for. This is not the place to go to if you want to relax or be pampered, but if you just need a cheap place to crash and aren't too demanding, then this will be fine. Also, free wireless! When we were looking at a hotel in Vieques, our budget was our main concern. We paid about $80-90/night here, taxes included, and though we had a pleasant enough experience, I think I would stay elsewhere if I ever came back. Here is why: I would either pay more to have a beachfront location + all included amenities (at Casa Alta Vista you are nickle&dimed for *everything* so that in the end it is not so cheap, plus it would be worth it to pay a bit more to be on the beach), or I would stay in Isabel II instead of Esperanza - Esperanza is supertouristy, and all of the restaurants are run by Americans - at American prices!!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: staritasf
Reviews.Content: Vieques is absolute paradise! There are many beautiful sights to see and the staff at Casa Alta Vista can help you find them. Mark and Saritza are extremely knowledgeable about the island and are more than willing to tell you about it. It is important in Vieques to know all the secret spots because you could easily just get stuck on the Atlantic side and never see all the beauty of the island. The hotel is located right in Esperanza....the happening spot in Vieques. You are walking distance to all the restaurants and bars on the Malecon. Alta Vista has great packages for snorkeling and hanging out at the beach. They also have scooters for rent and an SUV. It is very important to have a vehicle to get to all the beautiful beaches. It's great to have car, snorkelling and beach accesory rental all in one place. I highly recommend Casa Alta Vista....you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP... there are much better accomodations for the same price”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTravelerBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at Casa Alta to do a bio tour. This place was just disgusting. If you must stay here check out the room first before you hand over your credit card. I was first given room #1, very dark and damp, had a basement feel since it was on the ground floor half buried in dirt. At first the check in person at the convenience store would not give me another room stating that everything was taken until we realized that the toilet was leaking into the bedroom. At first he told us to just turn the water valve off on the back of the toilet. When I threatened to leave to go to another place down the road he gave us another room on the upper floor. It was not much better but at least the toilet didnâ€™t leak and the sheets looked clean. I was afraid to look under the mattress. If it wasnâ€™t so late at night and if I was staying more than one night I would have left.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay with Family”
Reviews.Author: MotherMayI
Reviews.Content: In June 2007, our family of 6 was very grateful to have found a place where we could all be together to experience the Bio Bay. We went to specifically visit the Bio Bay. We stayed in the family room and it served it's purpose. Other places wanted me to book two non-connecting room which was out of the question as we have 3 small daughters and my husband and I wanted for ALL of us to be together; not down the hall from each other. This was a WONDERFUL place to rest after a long hot day at the most beautiful beaches I've seen. (Navio, Media Luna, Red, Blue, etc) It is not luxury but I knew that when I booked it. We would be exploring the island and just needed a place to call base. You can also walk to the main road from here. Management was VERY helpful and knowledgeable. The TV did not work but as a family we were able to talk about our Vieques adventure, and just have some good conversation and laughs. If you need a place to call base THIS IS IT. The mini mart is also a plus when you have little ones and we were even able to rent a clean cooler and ice for days at the beach. A clean microwave and fridge was also a plus as we bought food from the local food stands (delicious!) and had enough for lunch and dinner. If we ever return to Vieques, we will book with Casa Alta Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Keys traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Alta Vista for 3 nights in June in room #12. It is on the top floor and does have a end balcony/porch area but it is shared with 2 other rooms on the same floor with iron railings separating each room's outdoor 'space'. The room was small, very basic and shabby. Windows and door are badly fitting so the wall-mounted air-conditioning unit works hard to keep the room cold. Window screens have gaps so bugs and street dust does get in. The bathroom is small & functional but appears unfinished with missing plaster & cracks in tilework. The bedding is basic, the rest of the room had mismatched furniture crowded into a very small space. Yes - the guesthouse is within walking distance (5 mins) of the Malecon and its bars & restaurants so if that's what interests you, that's a plus. There is an excellent local bakery 3 mins walk from the guesthouse that serves good breakfast sandwiches, freshly baked pastries & good coffee in the mornings and a great pizza at night. Maritza's car rental service is very good. Price was $55/day - they delivered the vehicle to the guesthouse and they took us to the ferry dock after we dropped off the car on our last day. For the lodging price of $75/night its hard to know what to expect because it is an island location so if you're looking for a place to sleep, bathe and keep your belongings while you explore the rest of the island, it serves its purpose. On reflection I would've stayed somewhere else and paid more money where the room was bigger, cleaner and in better shape.

Reviews.Title: “Can we move in?”
Reviews.Author: EinarDeb
Reviews.Content: My husband's company booked 3 nights for us in a resort on the big island. However, we decided to see a bit of Puerto Rico on our own first, and booked 2 nights at the Casa Alta Vista on Vieques. It was heaven! No TV and no phone in the room, but to us, that just added to the charm. The staff were awesome - from JuanCarlos who detailed the various beaches on the map on check-in, to Mark, who offered to drive us to Navio Beach and took the time to make sure we knew our way back, and where all the beaches were. We were warned about mosquitos and I think we saw 2. This is not a 5 star resort. If you come here expecting that, you will be disappointed. The dog and cat are at home in the lobby. Everyone is very laid back. But our room was clean and the staff treated us like family. We would DEFINITELY go back to Casa Alta Vista. Those 2 days were the best days of our entire week.

Reviews.Title: “If you like loud a/c, mosquitos, and busted doors - stay here”
Reviews.Author: InternationalMale
Reviews.Content: I can tell you our honest experience at this hotel. We stayed for two nights. You can draw your own conclusion as to how they beat out the Ritz Carlton, Sheraton, Water Club Hotel, Intercontinental and many other world class hotels to be ranked #2 in Puerto Rico. - We were given a can of mosquito spray to kill the mosquitos INSIDE our room. My wife woke up with 5-10 mosquito bites in the morning and we both got to enhale dioxin fumes from the spray all night. - Our room, #1, is a basement room as in the feeling of a damp cellar. The patio elegantly described in other postings is enclosed by cinder blocks, a bathroom that non-hotel guests use and the janitorial closet. The far side of the gorgeous patio has all of the scooters and bikes available for rental. - The security chain on our door was broken and was not replaced. The normal door lock was broken and would only lock when slammed repeatedly until catching as advised by the staff. There is no safe and they are not responsible for theft. - The air conditioner sounds like an unmodified Cessna 172. Turn it off to sleep and it feels like the suana at the Sheraton. - The TV gets NO english channels. One channel comes in clear and all the remaining four channels are covered in snow. - All of the bedspreads are stained with we only can image what when you look at the reverse side, ewe. Every bathroom towel had stains on them, ewe. - Another posting is correct that the dog doesn't bark next door. They stand across the street to howl instead. It is perfect because there is no alarm clock or phone so you can rely on the dogs to wake you up in the morning. - I can't criticize the hotel for the kids running back and forth in the room above us. What I do agree with is that the hotel is conceivably quieter than staying on the main drag two blocks away. However, since you need to rent a car to get around, I would highly recommend staying at much nicer and far less tourist rip off places on the other side of the island (5 minutes away) and commuting the five minutes to this side to take a look. There is more than ample parking, or heck, take a horse that you find tied up ever 100 ft or so. We did find out from the locals that no one even eats at the restaurants on this side of the island because they are for the tourists. I did enjoy the food at Tradewinds. Otherwise, there are some great road side stands and better restaurants on the other side of the island. Oh, a quick tip if you do stay here. If you lean cross way in front of the tv with the door open and hold your foot on the garbage can, you can get one bar on your cell phone to get a call as reflected from the cinder block patio. Another tip. Island Rental car has the best rental car rates ($60 rather than $85 at other places) and gave us great service. They don't have hotel pickup but the cab ride is only $3/person to get your car. Everything is only five minutes from whereever you are. If you do the awesome bio-bay trip at night, bring your own waterproof flashlight (it is sooo dark) and mosquito spray. Both are MUST HAVES now that we went.

Reviews.Title: “Comforts of home in paradise”
Reviews.Author: OU1
Reviews.Content: Staying at Casa Alta Vista was one of the best experiences during my stay in Vieques. The beautiful scenery was complemented by a great house converted to a hotel with all of the comforts of home. The rooms were wonderful, but nothing exquisite. Yet, the people at Casa Alta Vista made it absolutely memorable. They all treat you as if you are family, especially if you are far away from your home. Downstairs is the local hangout, where you can buy groceries if you don't wish to travel to town. I would whole heartedly recommend Casa Alta Vista to anyone wanting to visit the beautiful island of Vieques. It is not far from the beach, has a great view from the roof (where you may grill as you please), and wonderful people. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Its was home!”
Reviews.Author: camphillbilly
Reviews.Content: When running away from the daily grind, and landing on a small island one would think that the catch of the day could be most anything. While I did read that the Alta Vista was plain, its much more than that. Simplicity is vital in a state of being. While at nights, especially weekends, it can be noisy, the owners were very gracious in making sure that the majority of night owls were well coached in the 11 PM down time. From the roof top in the evening you can watch the sun go down over the waters, the birds take flight back to the other side of the island and hear the sounds we often pay for on CD's in the States. Tropical birds, roosters and wild horses roamed and flew around freely. The roads are winding and publico's are loco but you get used to it in a hurry. We took Mark's mo-ped service and decided to do some free lance touring of the island. This is how you find the food, country style!!! Look for road side servers and watch the traffic flow. Many of the restaurants on the island are great but several are rip offs. Buy from the locals, you'll get your money's worth 9 out of 10 times. I miss my little room there even though I have a huge home and all the amenities. Its one of those places where a person could easily find themselves trading one life for another in order to really live and live great! Bill

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service for the budget conscious!”
Reviews.Author: lexington8
Reviews.Content: Casa Alta Vista has a convenient location, very reasonable rates (I only paid $75/night for a spacious room) and friendly service. Upon check-in, I was given a map and Juan Carlos explained all the different locations of the sites around town. Danny helped me check out and was very friendly as well, giving me advice on the ferry and such. They offer you help when you don't even ask (mostly because you might be too lost to even know what to ask). The rooftop access was great, although I didnt' have time to use the bbq grill.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you are in a Vieques state of mind”
Reviews.Author: sanfrannie
Reviews.Content: I thought being rated #2 was going to land me in a under-priced jem. Far from. This was worth the $80 I spent a night and not a penny more or less. I really like it once I had thrown my expectations out and adjusted to the quiet island of Vieques, far away from the four-star resorts that speckle the rest of the Carribean. Truth of the hotel - run down, but very clean. It kinda looks like I built the hotel myself and I don't even know the first thing about building a gingerbread house: mismatched tiles, crooked doors, narrow hallways...the funniest part was the furniture. I can't imagine that the furnishings were bought anywhere other than a ghetto garage sale. But like I said, it was clean, oh, and comfortable. I peaked around the island at other hotels and they were the same, mostly, or similar. Except that our room had air conditioning which isn't promised everywhere. Albeit our air conditioner did have towels stuffed around it to prevent it from leaking. The hospitality was TOP-NOTCH!! Absolutely what you would find at the Four Seasons. I would recommend it with a disclaimer - do not expect anything fancy or nice. Expect a clean, no frills, great hospitality tree house with air conditioning :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NeptuneHouston
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week in Puerto Rico, and it was wonderful. While the 1st 3 days were paid for by the company, I spent 3 additonal days on my own. One night was spent at Casa Alta Vista. It was clean and comfortable, and the staff was very accomodating. "Dan the Man" was very helpful as was Mark. I could walk to the local attractions, but recommend a vehicle if you want to explore Red or Blue Beach or other parts of the island. It is a small hotel with a personal touch that really is welcome in today's bigger is better attitude. I would stay there again and wish I had more time this trip. My girlfriend really enjoyed sitting on the balcony in the morning drinking coffee (or beer in the evening.0

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: teeves
Reviews.Content: Casa Alta Vista offers its patrons a good place to stay for a reasonable price. My friends and I stayed in room 1 (only room on the first floor) which had its own large patio. The room had two full beds, television; small, two-drawer nightstand; refrigerator, fan, A/C, and private bathroom. The shower curtain was torn and moldy, but I didn't care much. The room was clean when we checked in and the housekeeping staff maintained it every day while we were out exploring the island, which was a major plus since we trekked in a lot of sand. I have friends on the island that showed us around, but I witnessed firsthand how accommodating the staff and owner, Mark, were for other tourists who asked for help and advice. The convenience store was a great asset for snacks, drinks, and even snorkel gear rentals (among other things). The public rooftop area had plenty of chairs and a grill, and offered a great view of the surrounding area, mountains, and ocean. We didn't have any problem with barking dogs waking us up at night. There was a dog next door, but he didn't make much noise during the night. We didn't hear any chickens. The noisiest things were the A/C (you can set the fan to a lower speed when sleeping) and the rain hitting the metal A/C unit from the outside (which is beyond Casa Alta Vista's control). Casa Alta Vista is on the main road that leads to the popular tourist and local strip called Malecon. However, it's far enough down the road (1-2 minute walk) where it's quiet and away from the hustle and bustle of the restaurants, but close enough to still be convenient. (Tip: Try not to eat most meals at restaurants that line the Malecon strip--food is very expensive. Buy breakfast and lunch from little bakeries and road-side stands. They may seem shady, but the food is tasty and very cheap.) The beach is just across the street, but it's mostly a boat harbor. Sun Bay is farther down the road, perhaps a five minute walk. I would highly recommend renting a Jeep and going out to Navio Bay (between Sun Bay and Bio Bay) because it's less crowded and the sand and water are pristine. Our local friends took us to many beaches, but we always returned to Navio at the end of each day. (Tip: If there are spotty showers in the forecast, don't run away. Just stay at the beach and the rain may pass in five minutes. What's a few little rain drops if you'll be swimming in an ocean anyway?) To summarize, you may be taken aback at it's "homely" appearance, but you should never expect a high-end resort on the island without paying a couple hundred dollars a night. We enjoyed our stay at Casa Alta Vista. It was convenient, the staff was helpful, and the rooms were well-maintained. We already want to plan another trip and this hotel will be our first choice for lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Alta Vista is da bomb”
Reviews.Author: superflygirl123
Reviews.Content: Casa Alta Vista was clean, the people were friendly, it was a decent, nice, inexpensive place to stay. We chose this place because of the wonderful reviews on Trip Advisor. It is located in a great place, central to the strip of restaurants and small (overpriced) shops. There is a nice bakery around the corner with sandwiches and inexpensive eats, great pizza. Not much to say about the hotel except that they are nice, clean, all you want in a little island hotel, and at a great price! We had a very positive experience with this place. Other things about Vieques - You must rent a car in Vieques - no other way to get around the island, really. Biobay is a MUST. We did Aquafrenzy Kayaks with Tim. We did the tour where we went to the mangroves and the private beach that you can only reach by kayak, and then to the biobay which was absolutely amazing. Beware there is a lot of muck in the mangroves, its an interesting experience totally worth the $75. I learned a lot. I could have passed on the harmonica playing and singing country songs that Tim did though. Tim is a little bit of a character, a self proclaimed hick from somewhere in middle America I should say, and has some racist comments here and there which were a bit offensive. I don't think he knew that he was being offensive, because he was nice otherwise, a little bit of a creepy vibe though (if you are females). We went to some awesome beaches, they had some people but it did not ruin the experience it just made us feel completely safe, none of this stuff about people rummaging through your car when you were on the sand, pickpocketing, etc. We were 3 girls - kind of wary about Vieques due to these reviews, but never once did we feel unsafe. Vieques was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly owner, convenient, great views”
Reviews.Author: dgdvm
Reviews.Content: There aren't many places on Vieques that are like staying in a regular Hilton - thank goodness! Each place has it's own character and we were very pleased with our stay at Casa Alta Vista. Friends of ours recommended it from their stay the year before. We stayed in room 12 on the third floor which has a corner balcony from where you can see the ocean. There is a rooftop deck for even better views. The rooms are small, but it was all we needed. Actually they were no smaller than others that we stayed in on different parts of Puerto Rico. The convenience store down stairs has plenty of snacks and drinks, rents beach towels, and has a microwave. Each room has A/C and a small fridge which is very nice considering many of the restaurants are not open for lunch. Casa Alta Vista is walking distance to most of the restaurants on the Malecon. The owner, Mark, clearly enjoys being a host and was very helpful in giving advice and directions. When we bought a bottle of wine but forgot a corkscrew, he jumped in his car, headed for town, and was back with one for us to use within 10 minutes! The staff were also helpful in making dinner reservations (which you need for many places), and even went out of their way to try and help someone find a place to stay who had shown up with no lodging reservations. Most rooms on the second and third floors have balconies which were very pleasant to use. The only downside to being on the top floor is the metal roof - and that is only during a hard downpour (which we had on our first night). I travel with earplugs anyway, so it was only a brief interruption in our night's sleep. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Easy”
Reviews.Author: AmberVacation
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Casa Alta Vista in March. I went to Vieques by myself and this was a good place to stay for doing so. There was a group a little bit younger than myself staying at the hotel and they were very friendly. I would classify this place as a cross between a hostel and a hotel. It was very clean and the staff was very helpful, but one of the blinds in my room was stuck up. It may still be that way. They helped me schedule a tour of the bioilluminescent bay (which was absolutely fantastic). Don't expect too much from the store. It's mostly junk food. Honestly though, this was my favorite part of my trip to Puerto Rico and I kind of wish I had stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: mollypants
Reviews.Content: There are no marriots or chain hotels on vieques, just small guesthouses. casa alta vista was great for me and my boyfriend to stay at. The rooms are on the small side, but who goes to vieques to stay in the room? There's no TV in the rooms, but there is free wireless internet, which was a pleasant surprise. There's also a fridge, and a market downstairs to get beer, food, towels, umbrellas, etc. We had a room with a balconey/patio area with a hammock, which was great. The hotel is a block or so from the "strip." i"m glad I didn't stay right on the strip because I imagine it would be loud. Casa Alta Vista only had the noise of the neighbors, but it wasn't a problem. We could also walk to the great beaches. The owner was really helpful. We didn't rent a car (even though everyone said to) and he actually drove us to a beach 3 or 4 miles away, and dropped us off. We walked back, and he helped make our day perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Basic Hotel in a Quieter Location”
Reviews.Author: srblue
Reviews.Content: On a last minute whim, we called and got a double room but were only charged for a single. This hotel is a little further off the "strip" but only a quick three or four minute walk and it's worth it to have a quiet place to return to. (A lot of other guest rooms were above bars and restaurants and didn't seem as peaceful). The staff was very helpful and friendly, even guarding our luggage for us after checkout and giving us lots of great tips. The rooms are basic but you don't spend much time there anyway - ours had a dresser and a refrigerator. The TV didn't get any channels but I think it is there in case you bring a portable DVD player. Overall a great experience - the people make it worthwhile. We'll go there again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, quiet, great location”
Reviews.Author: mayalavender
Reviews.Content: This guest house is located in the southern tourist village of Esperanza, within walking distance of some beautiful beaches. My room was clean. The bed was comfortable. The a/c worked , and I had a lovely view. Up on the rooftop is a working BBQ grill for any guest to use - also a perfect place to watch the sunset! Downstairs in the lobby/market there is a microwave and hot coffee as well as some basic provisions (ice, drinks, some food) for purchase. The owner seemed quite helpful with the young guests, even driving some without their own rental cars to a beach on the other side of the island, then picking them up later in the day. I had a great first visit to Vieques, and would be happy to stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: dapirate
Reviews.Content: I arrived Jan. 4th, early evening. I have to admit, that I was taken back by the appearance of the place when I arrived. But, don't judge a book , or a Hotel by it's cover. Check in was quick and painless. On short notice, they arranged a Bio Bay tour for that evening. That was just the first of many "little things" the staff did to help me during my stay. In the lobby you can get a cup of coffee, bottled water, soda, even frozen entrÃ©es. They have snorkeling gear and directions to the many beaches. Casa Alta Vista is one of the few Hotels that donâ€™t charge a single traveler double rates. At $81 and change (tax included), my single room had the 3rd best view from the Hotel. The best view was from the sun deck right above me. The room had it's own bathroom with shower, and an air conditioner. With the breeze, I never need to use it though. If you are looking to stay at the "Hilton", don't stay here. If you are looking to say someplace where you can quickly shift into "Island Time", then this is the place. Just off the beaten path, it is quite. Yet only a 5 minute walk from the Malecon, where everything is jumping. When they say "Good times, good people" they are not pulling your leg. I really did not want to leave on the 11th. Next time I go back to Vieques, I will book with Casa Alta Vista, and book the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon spot”
Reviews.Author: LAS25
Reviews.Content: Vieques proved to be a great location to get away from everything for our honeymoon. Orlando did a fantastic job orienting us to the island, drawing on our map where roads did not exist so we could get to all the marvelous beaches. He also gave valuable restaurant suggestions and booked our bio-bay trip for us, which was wonderful as we only stayed on Vieques for only 3 nights. We stayed in room 12, which I believe is the only one whose veranda overlooks the water. It was a simple room, but the bed was comfortable and it had a small fridge. We rented beach gear from CAV, so no need to lug towels, etc from home. The convenience store on the first floor also came in handy. I highly recommend renting a Jeep before arriving (Martiza Car Rental dropped off our Jeep at CAV). Keep in mind that this is not a place for those who love the night life, as most restaurants close by 10.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: MyAdvice
Reviews.Content: I can best describe the Casa Alta Vista as a one diamond lodging with a five diamond staff. My family stayed there for only one night (so we could do the biobay tour) and stayed in room 7. There were three â€œroomsâ€� in room 7, two bedrooms and a kitchen area. I use the word room loosely here as there were no interior doors separating the areas in this concrete structure. There was also no glass in the windows, just shutters and screens. That was OK, except you could hear noise from the roosters, dogs, and people partying next door. It wasnâ€™t bad though, because is located in the residential part of town a few blocks away from the bars that the other guest houses in Esperanza were next too/above plus the room was air conditioned.
