I mention this because if you are expecting complete quiet at night you will be disappointed. The staff at the Casa Alta Vista was fantastic. I never had a hotel staff that was so friendly. When you arrive they will give you a map and show you everything that you need to know about the area including beaches, the biobay, a place to get breakfast early in the morning, etc. There is not much in Esperanza; a couple of restaurants, shops and a beach were within walking distance. We did not have a car and relied on a Publicoâ€™s to take us to/from the ferry dock. The first Publico that we talked to at the dock blew us off for a larger group. The second Publico was nice and took us to the Casa Alta Vista. We took the advice of other posters and gave him about a 50% tip and made arrangements with him to pick us up the next morning to take us back to the ferry dock which he did. The biobay tour also picked us up at the Casa Alta Vista so we really did not need a car. If you are staying more than one day, I would definitely recommend renting a jeep.

Reviews.Title: “As perfect as it can get for Vieques!!”
Reviews.Author: ifontaine
Reviews.Content: We selected this property primarily based upon reviews posted here and a description of the packages that they list on their website. I'm not sure what a previous poster was referring to about the pictures. We think it was prettier than the pictures represented. We stayed in the desirable room #12, which is easily the BEST room there. There are six rooms on the third floor, 7-12, and 9 and 12 are the two best. 7, 9, and 12 all share the little verandah with each one having their own sectioned off areas. Rooms 8, 10, and 11 are not as desirable from a location point of view (no real view of anything). There is a roof that allows a beatiful 360 degree view and great views of the night sky. We signed up for their Eco Tour package and did a biobay trip, all day cruise to the Bermuda Triangle, all day kayaking, and horse back riding. In the end, we did not do horseback riding, and they agreed to throw in two more biobay trips for my inlaws instead of "losing" out on an opportunity. Lucy and the cleaning staff were great. We always had fresh towels, and the beds were made and sheets changed. One day, we had left out some dirty shorts and tshirts from the previous day, and they folded them!! My favorite story was on Valentine's day. My wife and I went on our Day Cruise with Captain Bill (that CAV set up for us) and when we returned we had a heart shaped out of three towels on our bed along with two complimentary drinks from the shop downstairs and a whole bunch of Hershey's kisses. There was also a handwritten note from the staff. The staff was fantastic. Orlando is the man. He knows all and is genuinely excited and interested in how you are doing. Mark (the owner) is also very genuine and I witnessed and experienced this interest and concern many times over the 7 days that we were there. They always had an answer when we had a question or were looking for suggestions. I can't speak highly enough about how great this place was. They took care of our every need, regardless of how trivial it may have seemed (extra maps for our inlaws to record their travels). I have very few complaints, and most of them are really outside of the hotel's control. 1. Road traffic...Flamboyan St. is the major entrance into Esperanza from the west side of the island. And the locals drive, shall I say, "enthusiastically". This obviously creates a lot of road noise. 2. Dogs. Or should I say, Dog. The dog next door would bark at anything or anyone if he was left out at night. Fortunately, this only happend two of the six nights we were there, and we had the A/C on the second night so it was much less annoying. 3. Bed was tired. Mark really needs to address the mattress issue soon. 4. I speak a little spanish, but I rely on the people I'm talking me to make sure the conversation has the desired effect. They have one attendant (I called "Il Muto") that only stood and stared at you when you talked. He needs to be trained again. Overall though, this place is fantastic. Close to the "American" side of the Island and easy to get everywhere else. Vieques will now always be on our vacation radar, and CAV will always be one of main considerations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it - except for the darn dogs!”
Reviews.Author: Jen G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Alta Vista from 2/10 - 2/13. I loved everything about it. The rooms were basic but exactly what we expected. We had room #12 that had a hammock on the balcony. We had a view of the mountains and the ocean fom our balcony and rooftop. There is a store down below that sells snacks, drinks, and rents out chairs, towels, snorkeling gear for the beaches. It was great to have that right near us. The staff is great. Very helpful and fully described the maps. The rooms were very clean. We loved the rooftop views of the stars at night. I have never seen that many stars before in my life. The location is great - a short walk to the strip of restaurants in Esperanza. A very safe location. (although there was not anywhere in Vieques that we did not feel safe). I really did love it here but the one reason why I may not stay again is the dogs across the street. I had heard that we may hear roosters early in the morning and this is true (right around 4:30am and they don't stop until afternoon) but that wasn't much of an issue. However, there was a large group of dogs that lived at the property next door that would bark for a couple of hours at night. That was not fun. We would spend the next day yawning! I'm sure there isn't much the motel can do about that but I think that it's fair to warn people about it. Other than that we would stay here every year - maybe earplugs?? Jenni

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: trevasta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last September and and a great experience!!! We are a young newlywed couple and we wanted a nice island getaway. We definitely got what we wanted. Our room was plain: two beds, a dresser, a mini refrigerator. No tv, which was fine by us. We didn't go to the caribbean to watch tv. The room was cleaned once per day and there were no issues with anything about the room. The staff was amazing. They treat you more like friends coming to visit their home rather than hotel staff. We were given a map and shown everything we needed/wanted to know about the island. One day we wanted to go to a great secluded beach, so the owner suggested one for us and drove us there. Also because it is a small island, the various staff seemed to know someone who worked for any company on the island that we wanted to contact and would call them for us. This was great for renting our car and getting the bio bay tour set up (the bio bay is a MUST!!!) We rented a scooter one day from them. It was a pretty beat up scooter, but ran well and got us where we needed to go. The hotel is located within short walking distance from the main strip of the tiny town of Esperanza. Isabel Segunda is a short 5 minute ride by car, scooter, or publico (like a taxi).

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: BananasNY
Reviews.Content: This is a tiny island, don't go if you are expected fancy restaurants and the spectacular nightlife of a bigger more tourist orientated island. Casa Alta Vista was well priced for the room type and what they offered, the view was amazing, a beautiful sunset every night, the deck was shared, but each rooms section was partitioned off nicely. Our room was clean, (yes a bit outdated, but it did look like the picture in the website) housekeeping service was efficient and friendly, although they do smoke outside the rooms on their breaks which is not good for non-smokers. Location ideal for those wanting a peaceful trip and just a quick walk from the Esperanza Malecon. Mark, the owner was very accomodating and informative about what to do on the island. Yes, the dogs and chickens are audible, as are the clip clop of the horses going by but this is a tropical island and it lends toward the charm. We learned in Hawaii to always bring earplugs. Also be aware, if you are on the top floor the rains at night can be loud, luckily we think the rain is romantic. We'll go again!! ;)

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donnercruz
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking so we could go to Bio Bay for the Bioluminescent experience. The hotel was cheap and the room fit our family, but we had a view of the building next door (close enough to touch. This place is no frills, but clean and close to town.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice ... excellent service”
Reviews.Author: walkabout_forever
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days early Jan, and had a fantastic time. The hotel was very nice, and the room was very big (we stayed in a family room because other's were booked). Would have been perfect for a family - very clean. The roof is awsome to watch the sunsets. We didn't rent a car - mostly because of the cost and because it was pretty much booked out. It was OK because we intended to spend a lot of time at the beach and generally chill out. We were talking to the owner, Mark, one morning, and he offered us to take a drive with him, and he spent 3-4 hours showing us all over the island - a tour that we couldn't have even done if we had rented a car. He took us to out of the way places, and 4wd'ing through the old naval reservation, beaches, and he showed us the old bomb shelters. He was very knowledgable about the island, and really gave us a complete history of Vieques. It really completed the trip for us ... and worth so much more than any tour could possibly provide. Absolutely recommend staying here, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay; better room last time.”
Reviews.Author: pickatty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my parents in March, and returned with my husband and teenagers for the biobay experience. We had the room on the main floor in March, and room 10 (second floor) this time. Not impressed with room 10! On check-in this time, there was a young man working behind the counter. He was polite, but I hope the issues were due to his lack of English skills rather than IQ. If he had simply said he didn't understand English, that would have made it a little easier to deal with! Room 10 had 2 beds and did accommodate the 4 of us. There was a small fridge, which was nice. However, the bathroom door did not latch & there was no shower curtain, so the teenagers (one boy & one girl) were rather horrified when in the shower or restroom that someone would walk in!. Generally, the room was clean. Unlike many of the other rooms, there was no balcony. We were only here one night on Dec. 28, so it was not a big deal to us, but if you are going to stay for any longer than a night, I strongly recommend getting a different room. On checkout, Mark (the owner) was there, and as he is known to do, spent some time giving great advice. He is a huge asset to this hotel. The hotel is not on the beach and has no pool, but is relatively close to the downtown where there are a few restaurants and bars. If you come to Vieques, TAKE THE BIOBAY TOUR, but pay attention to the moon - you will want to go on a dark night. And, take the kayak trip & be sure to swim! The hotel has a convenience store on the main floor and free parking. The beaches on Vieques are amazing, and even at this busy time of year, nearly vacant. (some photos from my March trip are on my photo website at [----]). If you want peace & quiet and gorgeous sandy beaches, head to Vieques. If you want a reasonably priced hotel with a friendly owner, Casa Alta Vista is a good choice. If you need lots of nightlife & a fancy pool, try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: KingsCourt
Reviews.Content: I visited with my wife, 2-year old, and my in-laws. We stayed in a unit that had a queen size bed in one room, and a bunk bed with a full on the bottom, and a twin on top, in the other room, and a small dining table, and refrigerator. It was perfect to accomadate my group. The price was pretty much $100 per night, which was very good, relatively speaking. Price is just part of the value, and Casa Alta Vista definitely delivered as far as the room, and ESPECIALLY as far as the hospitality of the staff. The place was nothing fancy, but totally adequate and functional. It doesn't hurt that they have a mini grocery/convenience store on the ground floor. I had originally made reservations at a questhouse in Isabel Segunda, but there was a mix-up, and we found ourselves with nowhere to stay. We were referred to Casa Alta Vista, and it turned out to be a blessing. It was our first time in Vieques, and we were just staying for one night, with our primary goal being the bioluminescent bay. The bio-bay ended up being in the south of the island, and conveniently enough, that's where Casa Alta Vista is located. Better yet, we had reservations to see the bio-bay with Blue Caribe Tours, which was literally within walking distance from the "hotel." The original place where we had reservations was in Isabel Segunda (north part of island). Bottom line: I would definitely recommend as a place to stay in Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: If you like beaches and "off the beaten track" destinations -- not to mention a very cool opportunity to swim in a bioluminescent bay -- Vieques is a very worthwhile place to visit for a few days (or stay a week if you REALLY want to chill out). Since almost all the hotels are off the beach, you're not going to find many "resorts" (well, they're opening an expensive "W" hotel on the north shore, at the mediocre "Gringo Beach"). So you're likely to be staying at a small inn, and I think Casa Alta Vista is a good choice. Like most buildings on Vieques, it looks less than impressive, but the rooms (at least the renovated rooms) are comfortable enough and represent good value. Ours had both a refrigerator and a microwave, which were useful. The location is excellent, as so many posters below have said. What is also quite true is that the hospitality at Casa Alta Vista is exceptional. The staff is friendly and extremely helpful. It's really THE reason to recommend the place. FWIW, we took our rent-a-car to Vieques on the car ferry from the "mainland" of Puerto Rico which was very affordable and easy -- easy once you found out the schedule and made your reservation way in advance! Nobody seemed to know whether this was permissible to do (hey, we weren't leaving PR), but nobody stops you from doing it either. You'll definitely want some transportation once on Vieques. El Topacio is a great choice for a fairly inexpensive Carribean lobster dinner, but otherwise reconfirm that the restaurant you want to go to will be open. We had 2 or 3 instances of restaurants not being open when they were supposed to be -- including one place that stopped serving lunch at EXACTLY 1 pm (too late at 1:05 pm). Definitely do the biobay on a moonless night. The $30 fee Island Adventures charges is probably overpriced (I suspect their owners are the richest people on the island!), but worth every penny. A truly amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: DrRhythm
Reviews.Content: Casa Alta Vista was our little home away from home for 2 nights last week. I have to echo the comments from the other reviewers regarding the staff at C.A.V. They were awesome. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, they were extremely helpful, super cool and friendly, and had lots of information on Vieques. We dealt with Orlando, who's one of the nicest people I've met. The room was on the more rugged side (and we actually had a bat in our room one of the nights!!....but the management were shocked and said it was the first time it's happened. I believe them given how rare that is). But even with our winged visitor, the view from our terrace with the hammock was unreal. The rooftop is beautiful and we spent the evening stargazing (the view of the stars in Vieques is unbeatable). The location is PERFECT. It's on Calle Flamboyan, where all the action is, but it's up a little ways from the craziness. Trust me, this is what you want...that strip is filled with cars cruising up and down all night blasting reggaeton from their stereos. You get to be a short walk from all the action, but also get a good night's sleep. All in all, we loved Casa Alta Vista. Don't let the bat deter you!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough”
Reviews.Author: kellg
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough for the staff at Casa Alta Vista. While the room we had was not yet renovated (they're doing a big overhaul on some of the rooms), we had a gorgeous porch with a hammock and a perfect view of the sunset. And every single person we encountered at Casa Alta Vista went out of their way to help us with any and everything we needed on the island. From rental cars, to beach and restaurant recommendations, snorkel equipment, bike rentals, everyone was so nice and helpful. Also, the location of this hotel is PERFECT! It's slightly up the road from the main strip of restaurants and hotels, but it's a nice quick walk and it's great to be able to go back to a quiet room and still feel like you're right next to everything. The rooms are extremely reasonably priced, the store downstairs is perfect for grabbing some Medallas to bring to your room while you get ready to go out, and if you need reservations or a car rental, someone is always there to help you get what you need right away. A special thanks to Lawrence for all his hospitality. You helped make our trip unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “A place to lay your head...”
Reviews.Author: Gracie216
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Casa Alta Vista in August with my husband. We LOVED Vieques....great food, great beaches, and very relaxing. Casa Alta Vista offered a bit of a run-down room on the island paradise. In all fairness, we were not in one of the remodeled rooms. However, perhaps the "ruggedness" of the rooms was a bit much for me -- I wasn't too big a fan of sharing the shower with an army of ants. However, the ants were taken care of immediately when we asked. If I were to go again, I would definitely try to stay in one of the remodeled rooms. Now for the BEST part of Casa Alta Vista -- Ricky. He was so detailed in his descriptions of where to go and what to see, he made seeing the best of the island so simple! We thank him for his many recommendations from food to beaches! He was more friendly, helpful, and attentive than anyone I have ever come across on vacation. So, in general, Casa Alta Vista provides a rustic room on an excellent island with VERY good hosts (Ricky and Mark)...not too shabby!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Clean Rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: wasif20
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. We absolutely loved Vieques and we also loved Casa Alta Vista. Its a nice guest house that was very clean and convenient to the beach. There was no phone or closet in the room or tub or anything like that - but it never mattered to us. In our room, there was a fan with a remote, A/C, bed, and a nightstand. For a few nights it would be just fine. The reason I would stay here again without hesitation is that the owner and the "concierge" (Ricky) were very nice and helpful. They made sure that our trip to Vieques was perfect, telling us honestly about the tours to take, where to go (Ricky is extremely knowledgeable in this aspect). That more than anything made this place an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “deffinately the best at customer service”
Reviews.Author: smilethrough
Reviews.Content: From the moment we called, Ricky the house manager gave us extra care by helping us book a car and a bio bay trip before we ever booked our room. He also arranged an exclusive pick up from Julians Transportation Services which I must add that it was very convenient for us as we had a very long day of traveling. I told him I would call back to reserve once I secured the bio bay trip. I asked him to hold our room and that he did. We stayed in room # 11 which happend to be Ricky's favorite room in the whole house,(Thumbs Up Ricky ;)...) due to the roof deck terrace access which was next to our door. We enjoyed going upto the roof to watch the amazing view of the night sky and all the stars we never get to see back home. All in all........this is by-far the best trip we have experienced yet in all our years of traveling to the caribbean in general. Thank you Ricky Guide Extraordinaire for all your help, tips and excellent advice and customer service. By the way...the staff at this hotel is awesome....Love ya Guys! Will be back next year!! Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Nice people”
Reviews.Author: misscreole
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for three nights in late August and had a good time there. I want to add that I am a female who was travelling alone and everything went smoothly. The guys at the front desk where extremely helpful in suggesting restaurants, beaches, booking me into a biobay tour (even drove me there in their private car when the tour bus forgot me) and getting me a rental car. The room was big and tidy (I had room No. 7 with a nice bed with posts. The maids did a great job. They have a store downstairs so you can always get basic food and drink supply and they also rent snorkeling gear for $10 a day. The rooms are simple and basic, so don't expect any amenities, but for the price and location (Esperanza is best) it is a great deal with very helpful people.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price, amazing customer service, rooms a bit run down”
Reviews.Author: buddha9090
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent two nights at the Casa Alta Vista, a place we picked based on the reviews on this website. We ended up getting in late on Friday, taking the 8pm ferry, and the front desk called us, let us know they would be closed, gave us a number of someone to contact in case we had any problems getting into the room, and told us to check in in the morning. The customer service was really very good. On the phone, I was recommended Abe's Snorkelling & Kayaking for the Biobay tour, and I was completely impressed with that company. I had planned poorly and not rented a car in advance (based on erroneous advice from a friend saying that if I stayed in Esperanza, I wouldn't need a car), and the front desk called around to multiple car rental places, finally found one, called us a cab and set us up. So, while the customer service is really fantastic, our room was very small, had lots of bugs, and was somewhat run down. That said, the a/c was fantastic, and my gf and I slept very well both of our nights at the hotel. For the price, it would be hard to ask for more. The hotel is conveniently located, but renting a car is definitely necessary to see the island.

Reviews.Title: “Resort attention, small town price”
Reviews.Author: mlawre2853
Reviews.Content: We just wanted a place to throw our stuff, but we found a place to hang out. Front desk was down home friendly, and gave us DETAILED points of interest all over the island with accompanying map. We grabbed what we wanted from their well equipped store and rental area, and they charged us when we checked out. Maid service was exceptional. Cleaned rooms early and often, and folded and hung our clothes left lying around. Rooftop deck had great views, and the air conditioning units were all new. Beds and room were extremely comfortable. We're going back!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Vieques”
Reviews.Author: Stevemac113
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our week at Casa Alta Vista (Aug5-12) and all I can say is WOW!! We knew ahead of time that Vieques was one of those islands where we weren't going to be imprisoned within the compound of a 4 star luxury hotel. We knew that the charm of Vieques was the guest houses and rubbing elbows with the locals. There were many guest houses to choose from and we chose Casa Alta Vista because it was rated among the best. As it turned out it was everything we expected, only better. Here is my top 3 reasons why we loved it. 1.) ADVENTURE PACKAGE: Buying into the 7 Day Ultimate Adventure was the best idea ever!! I've talked to people who have been to Vieques 6 times and never did the things we did or saw the things we saw with this package. Ricky and Mark set us up on Karl's mountain bike nature ride (which was awesome), we went horseback riding, snorkelling, sailing to the bermuda triangle, and they set us up with a car (which was there waiting for us) and drinks for the whole week, and a boogie board for the waves at Navio AND it includes the price of the stay. We did all this cool stuff and still had plenty of time to bum around. This Adventure package saved us from having to spend time figuring it all out on our own only to realize later that we missed something. We feel like we got the most out of our time in Vieques. 2.) STAFF: Ricky and Mark are the best. They are so knowledgable and have such a passion for the island. They really take you under their wing and save you from having to figure out the island on your own. Thanks Ricky for bringing in Fresh bread from the bakery every day and plucking Mangos and Anone from the trees on your way in. Thanks also to the cleaning ladies who told us about the paintings and jewlery at Luna Loca NOTE: When you stay there make sure Ricky brings you to the neighbor who makes Flan and the other neighbor who makes the frozen fruit cups for 25 cents. 3.) LOCATION: CAV is close enough to the Malecon (Boardwalk) of Esperanza to give easy access but not so close that you wake in the night to band playing on Friday night, radios and people walking by. The best shell hunting is right down the hill in front of you AND you have easy access to great restaurants like Trade Winds, Belly Buttons and the ultimate sunset at Blue Horizon. Thx again Ricky and Mark for helping to make our Honeymoon in Vieques the best.

Reviews.Title: “Just as perfect as described.....”
Reviews.Author: Big_Blake
Reviews.Content: Arrived July 14- checked into Room 3 with wife and two boys aged 5 and 8. What can you say about these folks? They go out of their way to ensure you can find nothing to complain about! CAV (especially Mark and Ricky) operates under the premise that satisfying every need you have will create die-hard loyal customers that will do nothing but spread good news about CAV - and book a return visit ASAP! A few random and loosely constructed thoughts about our stay..... They took possession of my rented Jeep from Martiza Car Rentals for me when I arrived- so our car was waiting for us at the hotel. Orlando checked us in - gave us a map of Vieques, showed us routes to all beaches, restaurants, sites, and took probably a total of 20 minutes to make sure we were well-oriented with the island. Room 3 was air-conditioned, clean and exactly as described in previous posts - simple but great. Whenever you need restaurant advice- they will be happy to oblige - got great restaurant tips from all members of the staff. Was never disappointed by a recommendation - Tradewinds restaurant, Bananas restaurant, Topacio restaurant, Taverna Espanola restaurant, Island Adventures bio-bay tour, La Dulce Esperanza panaderia and the colmado next door for all breakfast needs, etc... were all winners- they kept in mind we had kids and made recommendations accordingly. I recommend the beach bum package - two chairs, a cooler, an umbrella, and ice every day. It's like $15 a day and worth every penny. The small grocery in the office is super-convenient.... got our beach-drinks each morning, ice cream bars every night for the kids, and Medalla Lights every night for adult roof-top consumption. Tip for folks with kiddos - get some inexpensive walkie-talkies... you can set the kids up for bed-time with their portable DVDs or whatever and you can head up to the roof. When our kids needed something, they would contact us on the walkie-talkies, and we were only a 30 second walk away, but we still had a chance for a little non-kid relaxing..... Highly recommend the roof-top - think of the best and clearest night sky you have ever seen, then multiply the number of stars by 100, and there you have it. Views are great during the day as well. After day 3 of sharing a bed and having no personal space, our boys were kind of going nuts and they needed some space before their mom and I went nuts. I went down to the front desk, a little embarrased, and explained the situation- and Mark recommended we move to a larger two-bedroom unit - Room 6. Told us to go to the beach and when we returned, Room 6 was waiting for us. It is a unit that Mark has not gotten around to remodeling yet- but was excellent for our needs. Had a nice balcony off the front of the building. Housekeeping staff was a pair of the sweetest ladies you will ever meet. They do a great job, always greet you with a smile, and always ask if there is anything you need. Absolutely LOVED these gals. Weekend crowd was mainly folks coming over from the Big Island, and weekday guests were primarily stateside gringos. Mangos grow on a tree directly east of the building - grab some. I can honestly say this is the first time in all our travels (we take 2-3 big trips a year, and try to never go to the same place twice) that my wife has ever DEMANDED that we not only return to Vieques, but also to CAV. A good product and great folks..... A few other toughts about the trip- was only hassled once by a vendor the entire trip - and it was a young gringo male who was trying to tell us what a huge mistake we were making by going with Island Adventures instead of the kayak trip to the biobay where he worked..... all beaches east of the Sun Bay beaches on the south side (Red, Blue, Garcia, Secret) are ridiculously nice and ridiculously empty. Beaches accessible from Sun Bay like Navio and Media Luna were a little crowded, but still emptier than any beach you could find in Florida.... you can collect tons of seaglass at the beach just across Hwy. 200 from the Old Ceiba Tree - wife and two kids probably picked up 300-400 pieces in less than an hour.......take the time to get to know the history of Vieques before going - it made a lot of what you see on the island more understandable - buy the book "Vieques" by Gerald Singer - it's available on Amazon....... there's always a breeze - the weather in Vieques is textbook definition of "nice weather".........

Reviews.Title: “The People Made it Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DCFrequentFlyer35
Reviews.Content: Casa Alta Vista is a budget travellers dream--clean rooms with all the necessities, excellent prices, excellent location, and even a fantastic roofdeckt! But above all, the staff at the hotel were what made our trip to Vieques just perfect (Ricky and Lawrence in particular). My sisters and I felt like we were coming home every evening when we returned to Casa Alta Vista. We even felt like "locals" when we walked around the island and ran into our new friends. What a way to warm up an already fabulous beach vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After much research on trip advisor, I decided to go to Casa Alta Vista. And it exceeded all of my expectations. My boyfriend and I had a warm welcome, a wonderful introduction to the island and felt right at home. We stayed in #9 and it was simple, comfy & cozy. The only thing was that the bed was a little soft for me. The downstairs market was convenient & had everything we needed & the rooftop was a great place to stargaze &hang out. You definitely need to rent a car, otherwise you wouldn't be able to get to all the beautiful beaches on the island. There's so much to see and we didn't get to do everything we wanted to. We had a fabulous time. Thanks to Mark and Ricky for making our stay so great. We'll definitely be back . And the bio bay is a must. It's an undescribable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: abrahamj
Reviews.Content: The people at Casa alta vista are what makes it special. I can't think of another place where the owner offered me a ride across the island or let me borrow his personal supply of aloe after burning myself to a crisp on the beach. I only stayed there for a few days but how many places can you name where you know the names of the entire staff (Mark, ricki, orlando, lawerence, and kiki if you're curious). The rooms are comfortable (i stayed in room 4) and are nicely decorated. There are individual AC units which help with the stifling heat but like any place in the Carribean that's not the Wyndam there are a few bugs here and there (mostly gnats or ants, nothing large). Location is a short walk from "the strip" of esperanza but I wouldn't say that it's directly in the heart of downtown. This can also be a good thing though because of the peace and quiet the casa alta vista offers. It was nice waking up to a rooster rather then an alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place is Vieques”
Reviews.Author: ghperezpacific
Reviews.Content: I did alot of research before I chose casa alta vista. I made the right choice. the hotel is very simple but very clean. The difference here from all the other hotels on the island is their service. Thanks to Ricky, Lawrence and Mark (the owner). I recommend that you do rent a jeep and drive all over the island. Many beaches to explore. Our favorite beach was half moon beach and playa escondida. You must try the "bio-bay" tour; you will never experience something quite like it in your life again. I to wish i was able to spend more time on the island. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: adamnikirk
Reviews.Content: This place was great. The rooftop deck is amazing, the rooms are comfortable and cool, and Mark and Ricky were really good to us. I can't say enough about Esperanza, and this is a great place to stay while you're there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I Loved this hotel! My boyfriend and I came from CA to visit Vieques in December '05 and the weather was great! The hotel is right off the strip - great location. Close enough to walk and not be tired but far enough to go back to your room and relax away from the loud noise of the nightlife, which was great too. El Nasa $1 shots! The owner is super friendly - hi Mark, as well as the staff, very helpful, - hi Ricky! The staff knows the island in & out so don't be afraid to ask questions. There is a convenient store on the first floor along with equipment/scooter rentals. The room was great. Just a AAA+ all around. Picutre perfect views. Honestly my camera didn't capture the beauty of the 360degree view you get from the roof top. I Definitely recommend this hotel. I am planning another trip in 2007 and plan to go back to this hotel. TIP - the island itself has only 1 bank, which means 1 ATM, which runs out of money..so bring cash or Visa. Cash is a definite want to have because local vendors come out with a lot of nice pieces you are for sure going to want to bring back home plus there are food vendors who of course only accept cash.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me get things straight on here ... this island is a small paradise. There is a history to it and I will leave it at that. This hotel was fantastic considering you pay less than $65 a night (we stayed for 5 or 6 days and it cost less than one night on the main island Puerto Rico) and the fact of the matter is, you aren't there for most of the day anyway. The people all feel like family and treat you that way as well. Mark and his crew are absolutely fantastic. When we had trouble finding a rental car because it was so busy the time we went, Orlando hopped on the phone and called every car rental place finally finding us a great little place with awesome deals. There is so much to do and see on this one little island that we actually wished we hadn't gone to Puerto Rico in the first place and just stayed here the entire 11 days we were down there. There isn't much to the hotel. You get a cozy room with a bed, dresser, refrigerator and a nice bathroom. A/C worked great!! But honestly, you don't need a TV or anything like that when you are here. Walking along the beach at night and searching for shells, exploring all the paths to the hidden beaches and walking up the mountain is great fun. We got so burned while we were there because we were outside in the sun so much. Mark has great little aloe plants that he suggests you cut some off, stick them in the freezer and they do wonders when you can't sleep at night. As soon as you check in, whoever is checking you in, will get out their map and show you all the places that you can go to. If you have any questions about the island, its history and what might happen in the future they know what went on and what is going on. They are great!!! You wouldn't get this kind of service anywhere else. They love what they do and you will see it when you meet them and talk to them. One other thing, the Bio-bay tour is absolutely fantastic. We almost didn't go because it's $30 a person ... but it was well worth it. It is amazing you will never see anything like it in your life --- honestly, you should do it if you have never done it before. Seriously, this is the place that you'll want to come. It's just far enough from the hustle and bustle of little Esperanza but within walking distance of EVERYTHING. However, to explore the island in great detail I suggest you book yourself a jeep rental. They are great for the off-roading and you'll get farther than you would on foot. Have fun and explore, really that is what this island is for. Thanks to Mark, Ricky, and Orlando for making our trip so fantastic and memorable. We can't wait to come back and visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute best at customer service”
Reviews.Author: JerryMadison
Reviews.Content: Our group of 5 adults stayed at Casa Alta Vista for 4 nights, 3/15-3/19/06. We had reservations for all of us in room #7 for 1 night and then 2 people in the group moved into room #3 for the remaining 3 nights. The Casa Alta Vista has absolutely the best customer service of any hotel I have ever stayed at. The rave reviews you read about Casa Alta Vista service from previous customers are true! First the basics - Casa Alta Vista is located on the main street closed to the water. It is a 5 minute (at most) walk to the restaurants and bars. One has to walk on the side of the road and at times the cars come at you quickly. The speed limit on the island is 35 mph. The short walk on the road is one of the few negatives about Casa Alta Vista. Room #7 has 2 bedrooms. One room has would a king(queen?) bed and the second bedroom has a bunk bed. The lower is a double and upper is a twin. The matresses were good on every bed. A third room has a small apartment size fridge and freezer. We found ourselves sitting out on the semi-private patio if we were at the hotel. Most of the rooms have a semi-private patio. Room #12 definitely has the best patio...it has more space and a hammock. Room #7 could sleep 5-6 adults in a pinch. We opted for a second room because we wanted additional space since we were staying for 4 days. Mark, the owner, brought up a mattress for us to lay on the floor for the first night. Room #3 was below room #7. It has 2 beds and had a traditional hotel room setup. It didn't have the view though from the patio. Inside it was nicer though. The rooms are pretty basic. Functional. The area is more residential than the other hotels. You don't have the loud bar crowd noise or the stereo car noise from cruising cars. We did have some construction noise in the morning from next door. I will even miss the roosters that announced each approching dawn. Ahhhh...but the customer service. From the moment I checked in to the moment I left it felt like the staff was there to help all of us have a good time. Here are some examples of their service: I noticed my rental car had a flat tire moments before we were to take off for a chartered snorkeling tour. The staff immediately called the rental company for me, I explained the situation to the rental company and the rental company (Martineau) came out and fixed the tire before I got back at noon. I already mentioned the extra mattress the first night. They gave us great recommendations for a restaurant in Isabel (Topacia) and a biobay tour (Caribe). The staff runs a convenience store on the first floor and runs a tab for you. After the first day all I had to do was have them acknowledge me and my purchase as I walked out the door. I just settled up at the end. The staff pointed out the best snorkeling spots on a map for us. The staff was very good at taking time to answer your questions...probably the same questions they answer many times each day. It seemed like the staff enjoyed the customer interfacing aspect of their job and because of that I didn't feel like I was imposing on them by asking questions. The housekeeping staff was also fun to interact with. Great friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: conroytrans
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Casa Alta Vista on March 8th and March 9th 2006. We absolutely loved it here. Anyone who stays at Casa will be treated to fantastic, friendly service from the people who work there. When we arrived we were tired from a long day of travel. Laurence let us relax and unpack before we checked in. The next morning Ricky spent a lot of time showing us what to see, where to eat, and how to enjoy Vieques. We also had a conversation with Mark who was just as great as other reviews posted here mentioned. Casa is laid-back, comfortable, and a perfect place to stay while on Vieques. Anyone who is looking for a fancy hotel should not come here. If you are looking for some of the nicest people we've ever met and a clean place to stay, book a room at Casa Alta Vista. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Really overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're a clean freak, I definitely wouldn't recommend staying here. Though the staff is friendly and the hotel rated best bargain, it all depends on what you want to give up. We had bed bugs in our room (we paid for the 79$ room) and I got bit 16 times on the back of my neck alone from sleeping there for just one night. I may be more prone to bug bites but be cautious of what you're getting. The staff is really friendly and very knowledgable -- definitely consult them first before you go exploring off on your own. I don't mean to bring to their rating down but I just had a terrible experience, especially since it was my last night on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Informal, and Terrific”
Reviews.Author: pennydart
Reviews.Content: Spent a week on Vieques with my husband, our 18-year-old daughter, 13-year-old son, and two of my daughters' friends. We stayed at Casa Alta Vista, in two adjoing rooms: a regular room with a queen-sized bed, and the "family room" with double bed and bunk bed, easily sleeping 4. Each room had a bathroom, which was important given that there were 6 of us. The rooms were clean, the beds were reasonably comfortable, and the a/c worked very well. In addition, as other reviewers have noted, both the owner Mark and the manager Ricky were very hospitable, and helped us with tips about where to eat, what beaches had the best snorkeling, where to go fishing, etc. Ricky in particular charmed all four of the teenagers, who were delighted when he turned out also to be the guide on our Bio-Bay Trip. (And whatever you do, don't miss the Bio-Bay: it really is amazing.) In addition to Mark and Ricky, the maid who cleaned our room was unfailingly friendly, and tried to teach us all some Spanish. The hotel has a convenient little shop on the first floor, where we "ran a tab" on bottled water, beer, and Dove ice cream bars. One other advantage of the hotel is its location. It's only a couple of blocks from the main strip in Esperanza: an easy walk, and just far enough away to be quiet at night. There's a good, inexpensive bakery just around the corner from the hotel: in the mornings, either my husband or I would walk there and return home with excellent pastries for everyone for breakfast. Everything at Casa Alta Vista is very simple and very informal. Our room, for example, had a bed, a bed-table, a lamp, and a refridgerator--and that's it. But everything on Vieques is simple and informal. If you want fancy shopping, dining, and amenities, then this isn't the island, much less the hotel for you. But if you want to away and have nothing to do but go to beautiful beaches in the day and watch the stars at night, then this is a wondeful island. And Casa Alta Vista's provides a terrific home base: comfortable, friendly, and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd adventure on the island of Vieques. Though the island holds many hidden treasures...the main reason we decided on another visit was partically due to the atmosphere created by Mark and his staff. From Ricky, Orlando or Lawrence at the desk to the wonderful ladies who quietly sweep up all the sand and towels we leave behind. They're always there with a smile and a suggestion. (By the way take their advice for dinner at Topocia, the meal was incredible-do be prepared for "Island Time" service, but well worth the wait.)Mark has more things for you to do in a week's time. He makes sure you have gear, cooler, beverages and towels for each day of your adventure. Just get up & go. It doesn't get any better than this. Who needs a luxury hotel and a crowded tour bus when you can enjoy a personalized stay at Casa Alta Vista.

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great hotel deal in Vieques, the Casa Alta Vista is the place.This was our second trip to Vieques, the first being in 1995, and much to our surprise and delight the island looked virtually the same. On our first Vieques vacation we stayed at Bananas in the heart of Esperanza. We planned on doing the same again but were warned not to since we now have 7 and 10 year old daughters and the place can become loud later into the night. Bananas actually gave us Casa Alta Vistas name. We stayed in San Juan from Feb 19 to Feb 22 at an expensive resort,(really not worth it), then hopped in the rental and drove to Farjado to take the cargo ferry to Vieques. Be advised that rentals from the main island are not supposed to go to Vieques. We were the only car amongst big dump trucks and and other trucks making deliveries to Vieques. It was actually kind of funny. Upon arriving at Casa Alta Vista we were greeted by ricky, the hotel manager and Mark the owner. If anyone can make you feel like you're at home these two gentlemen can. Well informed about anything related to the island and eagerly willing to spend the time to explain it. My kids loved Ricky. The room we stayed in was #7 of the 12 in the hotel. It was perfectly adequate with fridge, a/c and most important to the kids, bunk beds. The roof deck provides a great place to have a sunset cocktail or to stare at the stars in complete blackness. They have a great little store downstairs and they let you run a handwritten tab throughout your visit. If you like cozy and inexpensive this is the place. It sounds like the guys have some great ideas for the place in the future. Cant wait to go back and see the results Thanks guys. ps- If you go on the bio bay tour, which I highly recommend, ricky also drives the bus and conducts the tour.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Middle Island, Long Island, New York
Reviews.Title: “If there is nowhere else to stay...”
Reviews.Author: sambuca
Reviews.Content: We were staying at Casa De Amistad in Vieques. We loved Vieques so much we had to stay another day, unfortunately our place was booked, so we started searching, it seemed everyone was booked. Then we contacted Casa Alta Vista. They had just gotten a cancellation so we jumped on it. Ricky at the desk was super sweet and helpful. The room was pretty gross. The top cover had mildew stains and other unidentifiable stains. The air conditioning worked really well. The bathroom was dirty in the corners, and ALL of the towels had stains,and were hard and scratchy. We were next to the laundry room, so I went in and took more sheets so we didn't have to use the top cover. I didn't even take my shirt off in bed cause I was so grossed out. We were grateful to find a place to lay our head, but I would never plan on vacationing here.Ricky was so sweet he even gave us a discount because our room was for a family and we were only 2, so he took $20 bucks off. The room was like $80 bucks, but there are so many places to choose from in that price range,do your research.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, Good bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon V
Reviews.Content: I went with my parents on Feb. 16 and enjoyed my stay at Casa Alta Vista. The room was big and had everything we needed. Thanks for all your help Ricky and the great service.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room that my boyfriend and I stayed in was bare bones. However, you don't need anything more than that since most of the time will be spent exploring the island. It was clean and that's all that matters. Rick, who works the front desk, is remarkably helpful and his advice/suggestions/knowledge carried us through the trip. This is the place to stay. Rick also makes great coffee!

Reviews.Title: “This Place Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Mizzhoney
Reviews.Content: Wow! What an awesome hotel and staff! We were there from February 4-8. Both Ricky and Mark went out of their way to meet our every need. Upon our arrival, Ricky took the time to go over the map of Vieques with us and show us all the best places to check out. We rented a scooter from the hotel which ran great but it was rough on our booty's on the gravelly beach roads so we asked if we could switch to a car and they magically hooked us up with a vehicle. We also stayed in Room #12 which has the best view. The shower was always hot and the room always clean. We felt comfortable leaving our valuables in the room as the housekeeping staff was very trustworthy. In general, we felt very safe there and on the rest of the island. The convenience store was a godsend! My man needed a pair of water shoes for snorkeling and they even had some in his size there! There were snacks, staples and a variety of beverages for sale and always free coffee in the morning for guests. These guys are running a top-notch establishment that deserves all the rave reviews it gets! Thanks so much Ricky and Mark, you made our stay in Vieques extra memorable and we'll definitely be back! We also did the all day Kayaking tour with Abe. We were his only clients that day and he gave us the best tour ever! He is so knowledgeable and tells you all the little details about the mangrove canals (which we actually kayaked through!) and biobay; I learned so much. We went to a private beach and snorkeled, ate dinner provided by Abe which was very good (from Bili - highly recommended) and then headed back to the biobay at nightfall to check out the most amazing, illuminating spectacle, the microorganisms really do glow! Abe is so personable and a great tour guide. I highly recommend his tour, he has a great staff which now includes his son who's just as knowledgeable! M & N

Reviews.Title: “2 more fans of CAV!”
Reviews.Author: going2pr
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed Vieques and our stay at Casa Alta Vista for two nights, January 28 and 29, 2006. We arrived Vieques by plane and paid $5 each for the publico that was waiting outside the door. It's true that they wait for more passengers, and it looked like the other couple was getting impatient. However, as soon our luggage arrived, we loaded up and headed to other side of the island with just four of us. Ricky was the best!! Friendly and personable, he gave us a warm greeting and the tour. He spent a generous amount of time telling us about Vieques. Since we did not have a rental car, he provided a great map and pointed out places on and off the malecon to dine and drink (try the roadside vendors!) as well as a few beaches that we could walk to. He called to confirm our bio bay tour and when we realized we left our camera in the publico, he called the driver for us. We knew he was looking out for us, so we didn't wait for the publico to return before heading out to explore Ricky's suggstions. Thanks, again Ricky! The hotel is an easy walk to the malecon and the neighborhood is charming. We passed yards full of chickens and one evening, a group of boys street boxing. Yes, you'll hear dogs barking and wake to roosters crowing. It's wonderful! The convenience store is just that! We grabbed water for the room and a six pack to take to dinner at the Tiki Hut on the malecon. We stayed in Room 12 with it's yellow door and yellow walls. It's not the only one with outdoor seating, but it's nicely situated on the end with the hammock. The room was basic and clean. I don't recall the hot water situation, but we only used it to rinse off and wash out our suits and sandals. The roof top deck was the perfect way to happily end the day! Originally, I booked with Hector's by the Sea, but because we were on a budget and wanted to stay at Casa Flamboyant on the mainland, I changed CAV for it's great tripadvisor reviews. I didn't go wrong! Wishing you safe and fun travels!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Alta Vista - How I Miss Thee”
Reviews.Author: coolhandluke
Reviews.Content: OK, so I am a bit overdue in giving my review of Casa Alta Vista, as I visited there for a couple of days in early December. Vieques found its way to the top of my Caribbean vacation spots, and I couldn't imagine ever staying anyplace but Casa Alta Vista when I go back. I am one of the Bostonians Mark took to go get a rental car mentioned in a previous review...but let us start at the beginning. Mark said he would hook us up, as we didn't know anything about the island before we arrived. And that he did. Took us on a tour of all the beaches and a little history of the isalnd at that. Showed us how to get home from the beach (Medea Luna cannot be beat) Next day we wanted a jeep, so he loaded us into his and drove us over to the rental company where we got a sweet 4Runner for short cash. Mark also set us up with charge account at the little store he runs downstairs, where we got beer for the beach, ice rum and etc. for the room, as well as snacks. Highlight - Mark also went across the street and picked us a few limes right off the tree when we got our rum and coke, then let us borrow a knife from his own pad to make sure we could appreciate some cocktails on the roof at sunset. As for the place itself...it is a nice building, good beds, clean and convenient to town - just a couple minutes walk. I couldn't have been more happy with the place...I was just sad to have to leave. So Mark, thanks and good luck and you will definitely see me next time I am down that way!

Reviews.Title: “a great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two college-student sons spent four nights at Casa Alta Vista around Xmas. We all loved the place- everything is simple and relaxed. The owner Mark made it a great stay- friendly and accomodating above and beyond the call of duty. Every day we just followed his suggestions to a different great beach with no crowds and great snorkeling. [He even steered us to a great restaurant in San Juan (Miro).]The rooms were simple, colorful, clean, and comfortable, with a great deck on the roof. It's only a short walk to the low-key tourist strip on the beach and a bakery around the corner. Mark has been there only a few years, so the place is a bit of a work in progress and will only get better. He is very interested in all feedback, and made us feel like part of his project, and indeed, his family. We rented a car from Martineau Bay Car Rental near the airport, and that worked out great. Several guests asked to meet with realtors, so we can only hope that Vieques will control its development so it stays as wonderful and low-key as it is now. Don't miss the bio-bay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Island Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms and helpful staff. The roof deck is amazing on clear nights and provides truly awesome views. The inn is located two blocks from the main dining stretch on Esperanza (although the stretch isn't very long), which is a beautiful part of the island to be on. There's also a small store in the reception area with drinks and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great, Seriously”
Reviews.Author: ikemay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Casa Alta Vista just last week, December 2005, for our honeymoon. To say it simply, Mark and Ricky were outrageously nice and accomodating, and it just felt comfortable. The location is wonderful, just a few blocks from the beach in Esperanza, and I cooked tasty pasta up on the roof on their gas grill. A few other recommendations: 1 - Ricky will set you up with Julian's car service to get from San Juan to Fajardo. We paid $60 and JulÃ­an's son, Juvian was a great escort for our drive. 2 - If you feel comfortable, rent a scooter with them. I can't even tell you how much it enhanced our experience just boogeying around the island, over to Red Beach, up to the vegetable stand, and past horses and coquis. That's all for now, but I was really happy with my experience. Suerte, and have fun! Michael

Reviews.Title: “stargazing with a beer from the fridge”
Reviews.Author: StyleT
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. Just nicely away from the main hustle and bustle of esperanza, so you only get the rural sounds of a tropical night. Only a short walk to the beach and bars. Great roofdeck to see the sunset, or star gaze in the clear night skies. Ricky and Mark are excellent to get you oriented and help you find the things you want to do. Rooms are basic but good value, everything works. It was great to have the windows open all night, the bug screens keep you bug free. The shop downstairs is handy for any bits you need, and they will organise your bio bay and kayaking trips etc. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Friendliest Staff Anywhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Casa Alta Vista where I encountered the friendliest and most helpful staff I have found anywhere. Mark and Ricky where extremely helpful and knowledgable. The rooms are clean with large bathrooms. Casa is within easy walking distance to wonderful beach areas and great restaurants. Everything is convienient---from a handy market on the first floor with reasonable prices;to car,bike and scooter rental, and even a refrigerator in your room. Stay at Casa Alta Vista you'll be happy, relaxed and feel as if you have made new friends. I hated to leave and can not wait to return! I feel lucky to have found Casa.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality plus”
Reviews.Author: iraform
Reviews.Content: Enough with the compliments, already. I stayed at Casa Alta Vista from Dec. 3-8, and discovered several serious lapses. Such as: 1) The hand soap is not French milled; 2) If you want 300-count Egyptian cotton sheets, you have to bring them yourself; 3) The wake-up call is provided by the rooster next door. If you require luxury on a stick, then Casa Alta Vista is not your kind of place. But if you can live with clean, simple rooms at a reasonable price, a location three blocks from the Esperanza malecon, and an owner who will do just about anything within reason to keep his customers happy, then you should check it out the next time you go to Vieques. Mark, the owner, and his staff know the island and go out of their way to assist you. One morning, while I was waiting for a rental car to show up, a young couple from Brooklyn told Mark that they had not been able to get any money from the islandâ€™s lone ATM the night before and were running out of cash. Then, two guys from Boston asked Mark if he could arrange for a rental car for that morning. Mark loaded us all into his Range Rover, dropped me off at my car rental place and made sure they had a car for me, dropped off the Bostonians at a different rental agency, and drove the Brooklynites to the islandâ€™s business district, Isabel Segundo, to grab some cash. This was my first trip to Vieques, and my stay at Casa Alta Vista helped make it a very pleasant experience.
